loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
Conchita works hard to support her family. Conchita is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like soap, soft drinks, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Conchita has been in this business for 8 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like soap, soft drinks, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Corazon works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Corazon is borrowing PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Corazon has been sustaining her business activities through her past 28 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Era

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Era works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.  Era is borrowing PHP 8000 through NWTF to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Era has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María de 31 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeña hija de 6 años de edad. María es una mujer emprendedora y visionaria ya que desde hace mucho tiempo se gana la vida mediante la venta de ropa en las diferentes zonas de su localidad. Vende variedad de prendas de vestir tales como pantalones, blusas, faldas, ropa de cama, etc. gracias a su carisma y buenos precios ha logrado ganarse la confianza de muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más y muchas veces no logra cubrir la demanda. Con el objetivo de hacer crecer su negocio solicita este crédito a FUSIA para invertir en la compra de variedad de prendas de vestir (ropa interior, faldas, blusas, pantalones, ropa de cama, etc.) y así poder llegar a más clientes que le permitan aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos y de esta forma pueda mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Maria, 31, lives in her own home with her partner and their young daughter, age 6. Maria is a dedicated and visionary woman who for many years has earned a living by selling clothing in different parts of the city. She sells different garments like pants, blouses, skirts, bed sheets, etc. Thanks to her charisma and good prices, she has gained the confidence of many customers who prefer her and often she cannot meet the demand. She asks FUSIA for a loan with the goal of growing her business by investing in the purchase of clothing (underwear, skirts, blouses, pants, bed sheets, etc). That way she can reach more customers which will increase her sales and income, and thus improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy underwear, skirts, blouses, pants, bed sheets, etc.

loans.name: Delmas

texts.en: Delmas is a 31 year old married man. He has 2 children with ages 4 years and 6 years. He describes himself to be focused and determined. He operates a motorcycle transport business where he transports customers from one place to another to earn a living. He describes his family challenge to be poor supply of water. He will use the Kes 8700 loan to buy a 1000 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future, he will have clean water storage capacity. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a 1000 litre water tank

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en:
Isabel is a 47 year old woman from the town of Dauis, Bohol. She is married with 5 children ages 26 to 10 year old. Her husband worked as a fisherman to support their family. She engages in dress making services to help augment the income of their household. She makes dresses and caters services like dress adjustment. Her business started more than 5 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy cloth and other materials like thread, sewing needles and maintenance for the sewing machine. 

In the future, Isabel would like to expand her business and increase business profitability for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy cloth and other materials like thread, sewing needles and maintenance for the sewing machine

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is a 26 year old married woman. She has 2 children with ages 4 years and 6 years. She describes herself as a God fearing person. She operates a farm where she grows crops and keeps animals. She describes her biggest family challenge to be poor water storage facilities. She will use the Kes 8700 loan to buy a 1000 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have clean water to use. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan of KES 40,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a 1000 litre water tank

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is a 55 year old married woman. She has 2 children with ages 15 years and 20 years. She describes herself to be God fearing person. She operates a farm where she grows crops and keeps animals. She describes her family challenge to be poor water supply. She will use the Kes 8700 loan to buy a 1000 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have clean water to use. This is her fourth loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a 1000 litre water tank

loans.name: Adama     F

texts.en:
Meet 43-year-old Adama from Waterloo Western 2 rural area in Freetown. She is married with 2 children.  In 2001, Adama established her wax print cotton business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support her home. She works at the business 12 hours per day 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of enough capital to run her business.

Adama requires a loan in order to buy more clothing materials to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. In the future Adama plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more clothing material to expand her business.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 57 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Leonila is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other supplies.

Leonila has been farming rice for 17 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other supplies

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is 54 years old and has five children. Luz is married and has one child who is in school.

Luz is in the agricultural business farming rice in the Philippines. Luz requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Luz has been farming rice for 30 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lyngie

texts.en:
Lyngie is 33 years old and married with two children.

Lyngie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like soap, shampoo, softdrinks, etc. to sell.

Lyngie has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Lyngie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like soap, shampoo, softdrinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 57 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Mercy is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to pays for the cultivation of land.

Mercy has been farming sugarcane for 30 years and also earns additional income from buy and sell rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to pays for the cultivation of land

loans.name: Ma. Milagrosa

texts.en:
Ma. Milagrosa is 38 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Ma. Milagrosa is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Ma. Milagrosa has been farming sugarcane for 8 years and also earns additional income from buy and sell livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Leam's Group

texts.en:
Leam is aged 34 years old and married. She lives with her husband and four children in a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. She is a rice farmer of 2 hectare of farmland. She has been in this business for 10 years and she also raises pigs to earn additional income for her family. The current business earns her family about 40,000KHR per day to feed the family but she manages to save about 15,000KHR each day.
This is the first loan for Leam with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to ask for a loan, as the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s business and earns more income to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Nozimjon

texts.ru: Этому молодому талантливому человеку 20 лет. Его зовут Нозимчон. Он родом из городка Вахдат. Нозимчон не получил высшее образование из-за финансового положения своей семьи и после окончания школы он остался в родном городе и устроился на работу, чтобы обеспечить свою большую семью. Нозимчон взял в аренду будку и продает там сим-карты, панели, зарядные устройства и разные другие запчасти для телефонов. Нозимчон не оставил свою мечту. Он очень давно хотел быть оператором. Теперь он у него появился шанс осуществить свою мечту. Нозимчон хочет купить видео камеру и начать предоставлять услуги оператора. Он будет снимать на камеру свадьбы, торжества, национальные праздники и другие разные мероприятия. В Таджикистане большую часть мероприятий и праздников проводят на выходные. Поэтому Нозимчон будет работать в субботу и в воскресение. По будням он будет редактировать свои видео и одновременно продавать сим-карты. Работа оператора на мероприятиях для Нозимчона не только давняя мечта, но и оно станет прибыльным занятием. К сожалению, чтобы купить видеокамеру у Нозимчона не хватает средств. Профессиональная камера стоит дорого и для ее приобретения нужны не малые деньги, поэтому он обратился за кредитом. Нозимчон на сумму он кредита купит видеокамеру и осуществит свою мечту.
texts.en:
Nozimjon, age 20, is a talented young man from the city of Vahdat.  Because of his family's economic circumstances, he was unable to get a higher education. Instead, he stayed in his hometown after graduation and started to work in order to take care of his large family.

Nozimjon has rented a booth where he currently sells SIM cards, phone panels, chargers as well as other phone replacement components.  However, he has never abandoned his dream of becoming a camera operator one day.  He now has the opportunity to make his dream come true.  He wants to buy a camcorder and start offering video services.  He plans to make videos at weddings, ceremonies, national holidays and various other events.

In Tajikistan, most celebrations and festivities are held on weekends.  Therefore, Nozimjon intends to work on Saturdays and Sundays.  On week days, he plans to edit his video recordings and continue to sell SIM cards.  Working as a cameraman and filming various events is not only Nozimjon's old dream, but it should also be a profitable activity.

Unfortunately, Nozimjon doesn't have enough money to buy a camcorder.  A professional video camera is expensive and purchasing one costs a lot of money, which is the reason why he is taking a loan.  He will use his loan to buy a camcorder and make his dream come true.

loans.use: to purchase a camcorder.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is a 53-year-old woman from the town of Dauis, Bohol. She is married with 7 children. Her youngest child is 20 years old. 

Rufina's husband works as a carpenter and a fisherman to support their family, and she engages in a fish vending business. She sells fresh fish to help augment the income of their household. Rufina's business started more than 10 years ago. She is asking for a loan to buy nylon, hooks and additional capital for her fish vending business.

In the future, Rufina hopes to expand her business and increase business profitability to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy nylon, hooks and additional capital for her fish vending business

loans.name: Nuevo Fruto Group

texts.es: El grupo lo conforman tres socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Hellen mujer de 33 años, casada, su negocio es la venta de ropa ambulante en su comunidad y alrededores  desde hace 4 años, Tiene de ser cliente de la institución 8 meses. Está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mercadería como pantalones, blusas, camisas, camisetas, shores, perfumes. Arli mujer de 38 años su negocio es la venta de comida y Miriam mujer de 45 años su negocio es belleza y estilismo.
texts.en: The group is made up of three enterprising members.  One of the members is Hellen, a 33-year-old married woman.  She has worked as a street vendor selling clothes in her community and the surrounding area for four years.  She has been a client of the institution for eight months.  Hellen requests another loan to buy merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts, t-shirts, shorts, and perfumes.  Arli is a 38-year-old woman who sells food, and Miriam is a 45-year-old woman who is a hair stylist and beautician.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts, t-shirts, shorts, and perfumes

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en:
Tahir is 50 years of age. He is a married person. He is also an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.  Tahir is a Fuzulu refugee. 

He has been growing vegetables and fruits for more than 18 years. He is very hardworking and passionate about his work. He considers it fun to grow potatoes, tomatoes and cucumbers and to plant fruit trees with his wife. He sells his crops in the central bazaar to make profits, in order to support his family. Tahir’s income from this business is 130 AZN [Azerbaijani New Manat]. 

In order to improve the living conditions of his family, he plans to expand his business. This requires a lot of dedication and effort. He believes that, in the near future, his sons will help him to grow the business. Since the vegetable and fruit business is profitable and fun, he wants the business to continue and prosper. He has applied to Aqroinvest for a loan of 1,900 AZN. This loan is for the purpose of buying new fertilizer and seeds. It will help him to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to obtain more revenue in the coming winter, which will help him to cover his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 40 years old and married with eight children. Seven of her children are in school.

Nora is in the agricultural business of farming vegetables in the Philippines. Nora requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional seeds and other farm supplies.

Nora has been farming vegetables for eight years now, and has borrowed five times previously from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Nora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds and other farm supplies

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en:
"Hardworking and industrious mother" best describes Rizalina. She is 50 years old and residing in Labo, Aloran, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. Rizalina is a widow with four kids. To sustain their daily needs in their family, Rizalina started a business: a food stand or mini eatery. She has been in the business more than two years now. 

Rizalina wants to expand her food stand or mini eatery. She wants to gain more profit and to have enough to sustain her family, especially for her children, so she would be able to send her son to college. In order for Rizalina to make her wish possible, she needs 14,900 PHP [Philippines pesos] additional capital and will use the money to expand her business. She intends to buy meat, rice toppings and all the ingredients, utensils and other things that are needed in the food stand. She hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her children.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients for her mini eatery.

loans.name: Nela

texts.en:
This 48-year-old woman named Nela is married. She lives in Dolipos Alto, Oroquieta City, Mindanao, Philippines. Her husband is a farmer who plants rice and corn for a living. In order to help her husband, Nena engaged in gardening activities like planting vegetables, root crops, and other varieties of agricultural commodities to earn extra income to sustain their family.

In need of additional working capital, Nena decided to join Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested 10,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] for buying farm and garden fertilizer and paying labor costs for cultivating their land.

Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the Cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. Nena is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances. She hopes to own a tricycle someday to use for transporting their products in neighboring towns. Nela hopes to live a comfortable life someday with her family.

loans.use: to purchase garden and farm fertilizer and pay labor costs for land cultivation.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married with four children. Helen is 40 years old and lives in Maikay, Tudela, Philippines.

Helen is a farmer and grows fruit and vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers and other chemicals used for gardening.

Helen has been a member of PMPC for eight years. In the future, Helen hopes to put up other businesses.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and other chemicals used for gardening

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be social. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes, utensils and basins. She describes her family challenge to be the shortage of water. She will use the KES 11,100 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that, in the future, she will purchase a bigger tank. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 10,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Lon's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of the Moung Russey district, where rice farming is a common way to make a living, Lon is a 56-year-old father. Rice farming is the main source of family’s income; he and his wife have been in that business for 30 years. His wife supplements the income by working for others for a fee. The current business earns them about 30,000 KHR [Cambodian riels] per day to meet the family’s needs.
  
This is the fourth microloan for Lon with Kiva’s partner, and he completely paid back the past loans. Lon has successfully used the loan to improve his standard of living. Now leading his group of three to apply for a loan, Lon will use his portion to buy fertilizers for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to have another source of family income so as to increase his income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farmland.

loans.name: Machimbo Group

texts.en:
Kaeni, who is in his mid 20s, is single.  He has been running a barber shop business for three years now. He works from 8.00 am to 10.00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Kaeni's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy a TV set, radio and two new chairs, all for salon use.  He is doing great with his salon.  Since he started getting loans from Tujijenge, he has been able to get the salon up to date and is getting more and more customers.  He is happy with the loan.  He has paid back all his previous loans successfully.  He used the profit to buy a sofa set, fridge, radio and to cover household expenses.

Kaeni will use this loan to buy more salon equipment in order to attract more customers.  He dreams of continuing to improve his salon.

Kaeni will share this loan with his loan group, "Machimbo," which has four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipment in order to attract more customers.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is a 48-year-old single lady who has worked as a tailor since 30 years ago. In 1990, she started her own business to make sure that she will have a good source for a living.

This long experience provided her with customers' trust and support. Her business is developing gradually; she has recruited a lady who helps her in replying to customers' needs and requests. She also asks for part-timers to help her during the high season.

Nawal is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary fabrics, textiles, and updated tailoring machines that will help her a lot in replying to the increasing customer requests.

She is specialized in tailoring curtains and clothes with special designs and themes. Nawal is a hard worker who seeks perfection in her business; that's why she always stays informed about the latest international designs.

She hopes to expand her business properly through buying new, updated tailoring machines.

loans.use: To buy necessary fabrics, textiles and updated tailoring machines.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn, age 22, is happy tending her little store.  She is married with two kids, and her husband is a tricycle driver. The store is their other means of earning a living to support her husband's income for their family.  Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood and so she makes promising daily sales. Jenelyn keeps running the store well, even though there is increased competition from other stores. Jenelyn believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Jenelyn has reached a year being a member of Paglaum MPC.  She has applied for a loan of PHP 5,000 for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. She has confidence that she can maintain the status of member in good standing. She is a hardworking mother and wishes to sustain the store and from there be able to afford a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of canned goods, sacks of rice, soft drinks and more for her sari-sari store (General Store) business

loans.name: Hiyam

texts.en:
Hiyam is from Iraq. She is 36 years old, married, and has four children. Hiyam helps her husband with providing the family income. Hiyam is a tailor and works from home. She has much experience in tailoring women's and children's outfits and has been practicing this profession since 2009. Hiyam is well-known in the neighborhood and has an excellent reputation. 

Hiyam is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. She will use this loan to buy two new sewing machines. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so she may provide a better income for her family.

loans.use: to buy two new sewing machines.

loans.name: Lovilla

texts.en:
Lovilla is single without children. Lovilla is 29 years old and lives in Labo, Aloran, Philippines.

To earn a living, Lovilla has an agrivet supply business. She has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns approximately 15,000 PHP [Philippines pesos]. Lovilla has been a member of PMPC for five years.

In the future, Lovilla hopes to save for the future, expand her business more and earn more profit.

loans.use: to purchase additional feeds and other agrivet supplies to sell

loans.name: Rat's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural area located in the Moung Russey district, where rice farming is a common way to earn a living, Rat is aged 35 years and married. As a mother, she has struggled to feed her four children by farming rice. To supplement the family’s income, she has been working for others for a fee. Having been in the business for several years, the current business earns her approximately 30,000 KHR [Cambodian riels] per day.
 
Rat has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for five loan cycles, and she completely paid back the loans. The past loans have helped her to improve her standard of living. Now, she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Kuoy

texts.en: Kuoy is 41 years old and married. She is blessed with three kids, two of whom are in school. To support her family, she does rice farming on 1 hectare and a half area. Kuoy is quite new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She is seeking this loan to cover the tuition for her son, who wants to hold a bachelor degree in Electronics Engineering. She hopes that her son will get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: To cover the tuition for her son.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be jovial. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the shortage of water. She will use the KES 11,100 loan to buy a 1,000 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standard. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 10,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a 1,000 litre water tank.

loans.name: Habib

texts.en:
Habib is from Iraq. He is 43 years old, married and has five children. Habib and three of his children provide the family income together, while the other two continue their studies.

Habib owns a small shop where he sells fresh fish. He has a unique way of working. He lets his customers select from the collection of fish in the pond, then he catches it and either cooks it on a charcoal barbecue, fries it, or sells it raw. He has much experience in this field and established his business in 2006. Habib is well-known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation.

Habib is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD. This loan will be used to install a shelter for his shop and to expand his pond in order to increase the number of fish in it. Habib is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he may continue providing his family’s income and the tuition fees of his children.

loans.use: to install a shelter for his shop and to expand his pond in order to increase the number of fish in it

loans.name: Zhibek

texts.en:
Zhibek is a first-year student of the American University of Central Asia, department of International and Business Law. Here is her story.

“I have studied at Aichurek High School and am proud of this. I think that it is a really good place where students can get an excellent education. For this, I must say thanks to my whole family for motivation and support. Graduates have a difficult choice. They must make the right decision about what they exactly want from life. This starts from choice of faculty, university and even a country where they want to study. I think everyone in our country and even in Central Asia dreams about studying at AUCA. My dream is to study at AUCA also. From early childhood, I was interested in law because of movies. I was inspired by things that I have seen. People who work in this area are like freedom fighters. In their behavior, they can be a little bit aggressive because in some moments you will need to be like that because in my life I have seen lots of injustice to humans. To become a highly qualified specialist, I chose AUCA, as there are highly qualified professors, who work with modern system. All the classes are taught in English. AUCA gives lots of opportunities to its student and one of them is Kiva loans. I would like to apply for a Kiva loan as my family is not able to cover my tuition fees fully. With the loan, I will be able to cover my tuition fully and dedicate myself to my studies to become a highly qualified specialist.”

loans.use: to pay for her higher education.

loans.name: Moustafa

texts.en:
Moustafa is a married Iraqi client who is 37 years old and has three children. Moustafa works hard to provide for his family. He is its sole support.  

Moustafa owns a carpenter’s shop. He specializes in making furniture. Moustafa has been in this field since 2010 and through practice he gained much experience in this field. He now has an employee and is well-known in his neighborhood thanks to his competitive and affordable prices. 

Moustafa is applying for a loan of 1,500 USD. He will use this loan to buy a piece of machinery specialized for his work. Moustafa is aiming to expand in this field and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with a better living standard.

loans.use: to buy a piece of machinery specialized for his work.

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Ilham is a 44-year-old divorced man.  He has two sons. Ilham is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his sons in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.  He is a farmer and market vendor at the same time.  Ilham has 15 years of experience in raising crops.  He usually sells them from his yard and from his shop.  His monthly income is 120 AZN from this business.

Raising crops takes a lot of strength and requires physical work, which is hard for one man.  Ilham's sons help him to raise the crops and take them to the shop. He raises cucumbers, tomatoes, pears, potatoes, carrots, apples, cherries and onions.  

Ilham applied for a 1,900 AZN loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers to improve the quality of his land. This will be his third loan, and he has a good client history.  In his previous loans, Ilham has never had a delinquency.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers to improve the quality of his land.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica grew up and got married in central Kenya. This is the region with coffee, tea, and dairy farming. It is also the region that has had a lot of problems with deforestation. Monica is one of the many women who use wood and dung fuels for cooking and kerosene for lighting. Their income levels do not enable them to install and sustain electricity. Their life is hardened by the fact that the forests are preserved and hence it is not easy to get wood. Monica suffers every weekend walking up and down the hills to go fetch water and collect enough wood to last her the week so that she can do other duties during the weekdays.

She learned about VEP and the biogas project at the community training and from some of their promotional materials. Determined to resolve the fuel issue, she approached VEP to help her construct a biodigester (a device that turns organic waste into methane fuel) at her home. She has received a biogas loan and started the lifechanging project that will empower her and her family with cleaner, cheaper, and more efficient fuel. This will also save her one day in her weekends to rest and be with her children. The biogas will also supply her with light so she will not need to buy kerosene anymore. This will be good for her children who need to study in the evening and can now enjoy more study hours. We believe this will improve their grades. With the monthly income from tea and sale of milk from her three cows, Monica will be able to repay the loan.

loans.use: To construct a biodigester.

loans.name: Juana Herenia

texts.es:
Herenia tiene 46 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Lagunas, su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio de animales menores, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su pequeña bodeguita y en la parte posterior cría patos, gallinas y pavos, es una mujer emprendedora ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de víveres, verduras y frutas para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Herenia is 46 years old. She lives in the Lagunas district, where the local population mostly works in farming and trade of small farm animals. It is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the north coast of Peru.

Herenia earns her living selling groceries in her small general store, behind which she also rears ducks, chickens and turkeys. She is a very enterprising woman. She is seeking a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles in order to buy staple groceries, fruits and vegetables to stock her business, and so make a greater income and achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy groceries, fruits and vegetables for her business.

loans.name: Thy

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district, Thy is 41 years old and married with three children. All of his children are still in school. The main sources of his family’s income are rice farming and catching fish. He has been in this business for 14 years to make a living. He is able to earn about US $12 per day to meet the family’s need. 

Thy is just with VisionFund this cycle. He is applying for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for his farmland.  He will also use a portion of the loan to spend on gasoline for his water pump to carry water into the rice field. He hopes to make more income so as to make a living better and keep his children in school.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for his farmland

loans.name: Kotognogontala Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  membres du groupe  KOTOGNOGONTALA   sont des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans,  5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des  familles monogamiques à  Ouayerma I un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso 3ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur quinzième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme SIRA  fait le commerce de laitue et d’ oignon dans ce groupe de femmes de  KOTOGNOGONTALA. Elle est  assise en première position de la  droite  vers  la gauche sur la photo. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt 28 paniers de laitue, 3 sacs de 50 kg d’oignon qu’elle revend en détail sur place en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 42 500 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The seven members of the group Kotognogontala are married women who average 36 years of age and have five children each, living mostly in monogamous families at Ouayerma I, one of the popular districts of the city of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are on their fifth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers.

Sira sells lettuce and onions in this group of women of Kotognogontala. She is sitting in the far left position in the photo. She plans to buy with the loan 28 baskets of lettuce and three 50-kg bags of onions which she'll resell from home to a clientele consisting mainly of women, paying in cash.

She plans to earn an average monthly income of 42,500 FCFA, part of which will be used to repay the loan with interest, and the rest will be savings.

loans.use: to buy onion and lettuce

loans.name: Faida Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre  membres du groupe FAIDA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 37 ans, et ont en moyenne  4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans Des  familles monogamiques à Hamdallaye un des quartiers populaire de la ville de Sikasso 5ème  région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle.
Mme  Aby  fait le commerce  des pagnes wax et de friperie dans ce groupe de femmes de FAIDA elle se tient en deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo. 
Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt une balle de friperie qu’elle revend en détail de porte en porte, au marché et en famille à une clientèle composée pour la majeur partie de femmes au comptant. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25 000 FCFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne .
texts.en:
The four members of the group Faida are married women who average 37 years of age and four children each. Most of them live in monogamous families at Hamdallaye, one of the popular districts of the city of Sikasso, the fifth administrative region of Mali. They are in their fifth loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to meet the needs of their customers.

Aby sells pagnes (traditional cloth) and second-hand clothing in this group of women of Faida. She is standing, second from the left in the photo. She plans to buy with the loan a package of second-hand clothing which she'll resell door to door, at the market, and from home to a clientele consisting mainly of women, paying in cash.

She plans to earn an average monthly income of 25,000 FCFA, part of which is used to repay the loan with interest, and the rest will be savings.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is 47 year of age and is married with 3 kids. Said is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.  Said grows fruits and vegetables. He plants tomatoes, potatoes, eggplants, and other vegetables and fruits. He says that even though this business is very hard, he and his wife have been handling the business for 10 years without any difficulty. 

Said grows vegetables and fruits and sells them in the bazaar. His income from vegetable and fruit sales is 150 Azerbaijan New Manats (AZN). He has more plans for the future, such as getting more land for cultivation. He is looking forward to increased sales in the coming winter because people purchase fruit a lot. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN for the purpose of getting new fertilizers and seeds. It will help him to grow more vegetables and fruits in order to get more revenue in the coming winter, which will help him to support his family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Agano Group

texts.en:
Delister, who is in her early thirties, is married with one daughter who goes to school.  She has been running a business of selling phone accessories and airtime. Delister also runs telephone money transfers: M-pesa, Tigo Pesa and Airtel money. She's run these businesses for five years now and works from 6am to 11pm per working day. She is able to make a very good profit per month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her ninth loan request which she will use to increase her Airtel money balance to service more customers. With the previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, Delister opened her telephone money transfers business and purchased more phone accessories. She used her business profit to start building her family's house. Delister dreams to open another successful business like Stationary. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "AGANO" which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase her Airtel money balance to service more customers.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura tiene 37 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos en el distrito de Colasay, caracterizado por sus paisajes verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura y comercio, a dos horas de la ciudad de Jaén, región Cajamarca, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposo se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado vacuno, ella ha solicitado un préstamo de 600 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para su vaca y de esta manera tener una mayor producción de leche para ofrecerlo en el mercado de la zona y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Laura is 37, lives with her husband and their children in the district of Colasay, which is characterized by its green landscapes. Its population works in agriculture and business. It is two hours from the city of Jaén, Cajamarca region, northern coast of Peru.

Along with her husband she makes her living raising and selling cattle. She has applied for a loan of 600 nuevos soles for the purchase of balanced feed for her cow. Thus, she will get better milk production which will be sold in the market in the region and in this manner generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for the production of milk from her cow.

loans.name: Ángela Del Rosario

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Jardín De La Artesanía se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Ángela, tiene 39 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene 4  hijos de 22, 18, 13 años y el menor de apenas 3 meses, los tres menores viven con ella y dos de ellos estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es chofer. 
Doña Ángela con la intención de ganarse la vida y para que a sus hijos nunca les falte nada se dedica al comercio,  vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ella recorre la localidad ofreciendo sus productos los mismos que deja a crédito y que cobra cada ocho días, lleva dos años en este negocio el cual es de mucha ayuda.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que ha tenido en todo este tiempo. Su sueño es aumentar más su negocio.
texts.en:
The Jardín De La Artesanía Village Bank meets every fifteen days in Montecristi County. It is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts, which are recognized at national and international levels. It is a place of the famous straw Panama Hats.

Ángela lives here, she is 39 and has a common-law marriage with which she has four children: 22, 18, 13, and the youngest just 3 months old. The three youngest live with her and two of them study in school. The husband is a driver.

Ángela makes her living as a saleswoman with the intention of earning a livelihood and so that her children never go without. She sells clothing of all kinds; her way of selling is door to door. She roams the area offering her products, which she leaves on credit and then collects payments every eight days. She has two years' experience in this business, which is very helpful.

She is going to utilize this loan to buy more merchandise like, pants, shirts, t-shirts and children's clothing. She has been part of the village bank since its inception and she likes it because of the benefits she's had in all of this time. Her dream is to grow her business more.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, t-shirts and children's clothing.

loans.name: Vilma's Group

texts.en:
Vilma is married with four children. She is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines.                         

Vilma is a farmer and grows palay, a type of crop, to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan of 7,900 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to pay for farm inputs.                                        

Vilma has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Vilma hopes to harvest more palay during every cropping.

loans.use: to pay for farm inputs

loans.name: Amin

texts.en:
Amin is from Iraq. He is a youth client, 24 years of age who is single and lives with his parents and 3 brothers. Amir and his father provide the family income together.

Amin owns a small grocery store where he sells canned food, dairy products, snacks, detergents, shampoos, and soap. Amin has been running this business since 2005, and has been gaining good experience in this field. He is well-known in the surrounding area, and has been gaining an excellent reputation.
 
Amin is applying for a youth loan of 2,400 USD in order to buy a new motor generator and increase his grocery inventory to sell. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he can provide better living conditions for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy a new motor generator and increase his inventory .

loans.name: Moushtak

texts.en: Moushtak is a married, 29-year-old Iraqi youth client who owns a small shop for selling mobile phones and their accessories. He offers to sell mobile phones with affordable and competitive prices, and he provides all the needed mobile phone accessories for his clients. He established his business in 2009. He is gradually gaining experience through practice, and he is gaining a good reputation in the neighborhood. Moushtak is requesting a youth loan of $2,400 to increase his mobile phone inventory. He aims to grow his business and increase his revenues, so that he may provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to increase his mobile phone inventory

loans.name: Hom's Group

texts.en:
Hom is 40 years old and has seven children. She is a rice grower on five hectares area.  This is her core income and business, though she also works for others for a fee to supplement her income. Her business has returned her about 23,600 KHR per day. 

This is a first time loan for Hom with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two, she is a leader. She is seeking 1,000,000 KHR; it is the same loan amount of her co-borrower. For this cycle, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop. Hom hopes that she can gain more income  than before in order to upgrade her living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina is 35 years old and single, living by herself in one of Kosovo's minority communities. Although she is working as a nurse, which is her only source of income, her salary is not enough to provide for herself any additional needs besides daily living expenses. 
Valentina is in a need of a loan to renovate her old house that is in poor condition. She believes that the loan will fulfill her goal of completing her home and having a better life, bringing comfort and security. She is hoping that in the near future she will get married and have children. She is very thankful to KIVA lenders and promises to make her payments punctually!

loans.use: To renovate her old house that is in poor condition

loans.name: Merlyn Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Jardín De La Artesanía se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Merlyn, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de  8 años  de edad  el cual estudia en escuela, actualmente está en su quinto mes de embarazo de su segundo hijo. Su esposo trabaja en una camaronera.
Doña Merlyn es una muy buena ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los  días de dos a tres horas al día, ella deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Ella empezó su negocio con el primer crédito que recibió del banco razón por lo cual está muy agradecida ya que los créditos han cambiado su vida para bien.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas y cosméticos. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque así empezó su negocio que le ha dado mucho en su vida. Sus sueños son tener una boutique.
texts.en: The Jardín De La Artesanía [Artisan Garden] Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton, known for its rich precolonial culture and for its craftsmanship, which is nationally and internationally recognized.  It is also home to the famous straw hats.  Merlyn, 31, lives here.  She is married, and she and her husband have an 8-year-old son who goes to school.  Merlyn is currently five months pregnant with her second child.  Her husband works at a shrimp farm.  Merlyn is a very good homemaker.  She sells clothing of all kinds and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and accessories for women) to make money of her own so she can help her husband cover their household expenses.  She works every day for two to three hours, selling her products on credit and collecting the money once a week.  She started her business with the first loan she received from the bank, for which she is very thankful since the the loans have changed her life for the better.  This loan is to buy clothing, perfumes, lotions, and cosmetics.  Merlyn has been in the Communal Bank since its inception and she likes it because it allowed her to start her business which has given her so much in her life.  Her dream is to have a boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes, lotions, and cosmetics

loans.name: Najeh

texts.en:
Najeh is a married Iraqi client who is 38 years old and has four children. In order to provide the family living and school expenses for the four children, Najeh works extra hours in his hardware store, where he sells both electrical and structural materials. 

He established his business in 2011 and has gained good experience in this field. Najeh now has a hired employee and became well-known in his surroundings, thanks to his competitive prices. 

Najeh is requesting a loan of 2,400 USD. He will use this loan to expand his store and install a rolling shutter. Najeh believes that this renovation will result in the improvement of his business and the increase of his profits, and will give him the ability to provide better living standards for his family.

loans.use: to expand his store and install a rolling shutter.

loans.name: Punler's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Ek Phnom district, Punler is 53 years old and widowed. She has three children, one of whom is still in school. She has been selling various kinds of vegetables. Having been in this business for almost 20 years, she currently can earn about 66,000 KHR per day.
 
This is the microloan for Punler with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, Punler is going to use her portion to buy more vegetables for resale. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Savy

texts.en: Savy is 40 years old and a mother of four schoolchildren. She resides in Kandal province. Her main source of income is from her dessert selling business as a wholesaler. She has occupied this business for several years.  This is Savy's third loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She has repaid her past loan completely to make her living conditions and her business stable. Now, she wants to focus on her son who wants to earn a bachelor degree majoring in electronic engineering. Hence, she is applying for a new loan to cover the tuition fees for her son. She hopes that this financial support will help her son to reach his study goals and get a decent job to earn more income to support the family.

loans.use: to cover tuition fees for her son.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is 23 years of age and a young, married person. Hasan is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He earns a living by running a small café in his city. He has dedicated his life to this business for more than 2 years. 

Usually his clients are workers from the construction companies in his town. Every morning he goes to the market to buy products for his employees to use to prepare meals to sell. Hasan's café is open from 8 a.m. to 12 p.m. He is satisfied with his business, and his profits come to 150 AZN a month. In this business, his brothers are also helping him. He is requesting a loan for 1,800 AZN to repair his café and buy new furniture. He thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to repair his café and buy new furniture.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from pig fattening. Jean is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other fishing equipment for her fishing business.

Jean has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Lidya

texts.en: Lidya is a single woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as social. She operates a retail shop where she sells cooking oil, sweets, bread, milk, and other household items. She describes her family's challenge to be a water shortage. She will use the 8,700 KES loan to buy a 1000 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business to wholesale. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a 1000 litre water tank.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 45 years old.  She is married and has eight children.  She earns her income through the sale of crops and livestock.  In addition, she earns a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW).  Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members, who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On her land Joan grows maize, beans, cassava, vegetables, peanuts, bananas, pumpkins, sweet potatoes and eggplants.  She also has cows, goats, sheep, pigs and chickens.  

Joan has served as a CKW for the last two years and she looks forward to renewing her CKW contract for the next three years.  Thanks to her Kiva loan Joan will be able to purchase the materials for her business-in-a-box (a smart phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes.  With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Joan will invest in buying some oxen to plough her land. 

Her biggest dream in life is to build a warehouse, which could house all her crops and farming tools.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Morish

texts.en: Morish is 25 years old and is married but does not have any children yet. He earns his income through the sale of crops and livestock and he receives a monthly wage as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On his land, Morish grows maize, beans, rice, peanuts, bananas, sweet potatoes and cassava. He also has cows, chickens and pigs. Morish has served as a CKW for the last two years, and he looks forward to renewing his CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW, he will use the materials in his business-in-a-box (smartphone, solar charging set, and weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of his village, which will help them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money he will earn as a CKW, Morish will invest in buying new agricultural tools for his farm. His biggest dream in life is to improve his living standards and develop a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale to provide vital farming information to his community.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia is 26 years old with one child. She earns her income through the sale of crops, livestock and monthly compensation as a Community Knowledge Worker (CKW). Community Knowledge Workers are trusted community members who provide agricultural data and advice to rural farmers in their local area including information about the weather, market prices, crop diseases and agricultural tools. On her land, Sylvia grows maize, beans and peanuts. She also has chickens and pigs. Sylvia has served as a CKW for the last two years and she looks forward to renewing her CKW contract for the next three years. As a CKW, she will use the materials in her business-in-a-box (a smartphone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale) to disseminate vital agricultural information to the other members of her village, helping them to improve their crop yields and increase their incomes. With the additional money she will earn as a CKW, Sylvia will reinvest in her farm. Her biggest dream in life is to have a sustainable source of income.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, solar charging set, and weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Saroeun is 54 years old and blessed with four children. Nowadays, only three children are in school, one of whom is studying at a local university. She has been involved in the current business for ages. Saroeun, who has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for three cycles including this loan, has repaid back her past loan wisely, and it has enabled her to improve her lifestyle better than before and keep her kids in school. 

However, education cost is quite challenging for one of her kids at the university level. To overcome this challenge, she applied for a new loan in order to cover the school fees for her son who prefers to pursue a bachelor degree in Electronics Engineering. She hopes her son will have a specialized skill so he can obtain a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to cover the school fee for her son.

loans.name: Chhorn

texts.en:
Chhorn is a rural villager from Kampong Cham province's Tbaung Khmum district where crop farming is a common way to make a living. She is 40 years old and she has three children, all of whom are still in school. Chhorn has been planting cassava for 20 years and she supplements the income by raising pigs. The current business earns her about US $21 per day to support her family. 
This is the first-cycle loan for Chhorn with Kiva's partner, VisionFund. Now, she is applying for an education loan to cover the entire tuition fee for four years for her oldest son, a 20-year-old freshman in a local university specializing in Nursing. She highly hopes that this loan will enable her to send her oldest son to university and also help her son to obtain a higher education background and end up with a good job after graduation in order to support the family.

loans.use: to cover her son's entire tuition fee for four years.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Kim

texts.en: Residing in Takeo province’s Prey Kabas district, Kim is 47 years old and a mother of six children. Nowadays, she has five children to cater for; four are in school and one is still young. She manages her daily cost of living via a rice farming and pig-raising business.  Kim, a first time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), is seeking a new loan in order to pay for her daughter's school fee. She hopes that she can help her daughter achieve her dream in holding a bachelor's degree in Finance and Banking and get a proper job.

loans.use: to pay for  her daughter's school fee.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is married with one child. She is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines.                

Editha is a farmer and grows the palay type of crop to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy farm inputs.                                                       

Editha has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Editha hopes to harvest more palay crops.

loans.use: To pay for farm inputs

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is 23 years old. She is the first born in a family of five. She feels that she has a responsibility to do her best in all her endeavors because her siblings look up to her to set a pace. She enjoys using technology because it brings people and organizations together. 

When she achieves her goals she would like to mentor young girls in her community. She has taken a loan of KES 85,000 to pay for an internship program at NetHope Academy. This will enable her to gain skills and experience required in the job market.

In the next 5 or 10 years she sees herself as a role model for girls in her community and being a professional information system auditor and an IT consultant.
She gets inspiration from her parents to work towards her goals. Her parents came from a poor background and they have taught her to work hard and never take any opportunity for granted.

loans.use: pay for an internship program

loans.name: Jhon Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 39 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Cayalti, donde su población se dedica al cultivo de caña de azúcar, arroz, y frutales, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica al servicio de transporte público, trasladando a sus clientes en su mototaxi a los caseríos aledaños a su comunidad, Carlos ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para darle mantenimiento a su vehículo y seguir brindado el servicio con seguridad, y una segunda parte para arreglos del dormitorio de su casa domicilio y así tener un lugar agradable donde residir.
texts.en:
Carlos, 39, lives with his wife in the district of Cayalti, where the local people are involved in growing crops such as sugar cane, rice and fruit, and in commerce and livestock farming.  It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo on the northern coast of Peru.

He runs a public transportation service and uses his motortaxi to take customers to the rural villages in his community.  Carlos has requested a loan in the amount of 4,000 PEN to provide maintenance for his vehicle so he can continue providing a safe service.  Part of the loan will be used to fix up a bedroom at home to make it a more comfortable place to live.

loans.use: To pay for vehicle maintenance and to fix up a bedroom at home.

loans.name: Sinoun's Group

texts.en:
Sinoun, 43, lives with her husband and six children in a rural village at the Sangke district, Cambodia. To feed the family, Sinoun and her husband earn a living as paid workers. They have been in this job for 11 years, earning about 37,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Sinoun has been with VisionFund for five cycles. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy a motorbike for her family's commuting. She hopes to have a proper motorbike for her family to use.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her family's commuting.

loans.name: Kasem

texts.en:
Kasem is 29 years old, married, and has a single child. He is a youth from Iraq and the sole provider in his family. Kasem owns a small cafe where people come to relax, drink coffee, and smoke the famous Arabian Hubble Bubble. 

He has been in this field for more than 3 years and established his own business in 2012. Kasem's business grew fast and he now has five employees. He gained an excellent reputation in his surrounding area and is well-known in his neighborhood. 

Kasem is requesting a youth loan of $1,800, which he will use to install a display window, rolling shutter and signage for his cafe. Kasem is aiming to expand his business and increase his profits so he can provide his family with better living standards.

loans.use: to install a display window, rolling shutter, and signage for his cafe.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Jardín De La Artesanía se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 24, 22, 14 y 3 años  de edad, los menores estudian en colegio y jardín de infantes, tres de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña María es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para ayudarle a  su marido con su labor, el tiene un puesto en el mercado  de la ciudad de  en la que vende frutas y verduras. Trabaja todos los días desde las  05h00 hasta las 14h00,  el se desplaza desde la madrugada hasta el mercado mayorista a comprar los mejores productos y así ofrecer lo mejor a su clientela que día a día asisten hasta su local a surtirse de estos productos, el lleva más de 25 años en este negocio, el cual le ha dado lo suficiente para sacar adelante a su familia de unza manera honrada.
Este crédito es para comprar frutas, legumbres y verduras. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan con  los créditos. Sus sueños son tener una tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Jardín de la Artesanía" meets every 15 days in the Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and craft work on both a national and international level.  The place is also known for its famous straw hat.

This is where María, 45, lives.  She is married and has four children, ages 24, 22, 14 and 3.  The youngest ones attend school and kindergarten.  Three of the children still live at home.  Her husband is a merchant.

María is a good wife and is taking out the loan to help her husband with his work.  He has a stand at the city market where he sells fruits and vegetables.  He works from 5:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m.  In the early morning hours he goes to the wholesale market to buy products so he can offer his daily customers the best he can.  He has been in business for over 25 years and it has earned him enough to provide for his family in a dignified way.

This loan is to buy fruits, pulses and vegetables.  María has been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes how helpful the loans are.  Her dream is to have her own grocery store.

loans.use: To buy fruits, pulses and vegetables.

loans.name: María Tenaida

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Jardín De La Artesanía se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, todos ya mayores de edad y aún viven en su casa. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña María es una mujer muy luchadora y que para ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar puso un pequeño restaurante en su casa donde vende toda clase de comida, en las mañanas prepara el delicioso ceviche de pescado que muy solicitado por sus clientes, tiene una gran variedad de platos para el almuerzo acompañados de jugos naturales y gaseosas, en su restaurante trabaja los fines de semana ya que ella también en la semana realiza labores de limpieza en una casa de la localidad por lo cual recibe un sueldo mensual. Ella lleva más d 20 años vendiendo sus platos con lo cual se gana algo extra y que les sirve para salir adelante
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, pescado, y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta por los créditos le son de mucha ayuda.  Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y su vida familiar.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Jardín de la Artesanía" meets every 15 days in the Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and craft work on both a national and international level. The place is also known for its famous straw hat.

This is where María, 52, lives.  She is married and has three children who are all adults and still live at home.  Her husband is a driver.

María is a hard-working woman who helps her husband with the household expenses.  She has a small restaurant at home where she sells all kinds of food.  In the morning she prepares a delicious ceviche fish dish that is very popular with her customers.  She has a wide variety of lunch dishes she serves with natural fruits and sodas.  She works in the restaurant on weekends because during the week she is a domestic employee at a house in her town where she earns a monthly salary.  For over 20 years she has been selling food and earning extra money for the family to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy rice, fish and other groceries for her restaurant.  She has been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes how helpful the loans are.  Her dream is to continue with her business and family life.

loans.use: To buy rice, fish and other groceries.

loans.name: Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is 28 years old. She loves technology because of its ability to make life easier. She has taken a loan of KES 85,000 to pay for an internship program at NetHope Academy.

The internship will enable her to gain skills and experience in information technology, which will help her get a job.

In the future she wants to be part of a team that will ensure IT is part of society. She gets her inspiration from the chief executive officer of a local bank who has great ideas, which are a great contribution to the lives of both young and old. She hopes that the internship will help her shape up her future and career goals.

loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 26 years old. She is a young and energetic information technology person. She has a passion for IT because of the ever changing technology that comes up. She has taken a loan of KES 85,000 to pay for an internship program at NetHope Academy. This will enable her to gain skills and experience in information technology, which will help her get a job. 

In the future she hopes that she will be a successful IT professional who gives back knowledge and skills learnt to the community by engaging them in training and different programs to improve their IT skills.

She gets inspiration from her father who sacrificed a lot to help her achieve her goals by being a good mentor to her. Peer pressure was a big challenge while in school but she overcame by being focused and setting goals.

loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en:
Carolyne is from a family of five children. She comes from a community where information technology is not well embraced. She is very passionate about information technology. She has taken a loan of KES 85,000 to pay for an internship at NetHope Academy. This will enable her to gain skills and experience in information technology, which will help her get a job.

In 5 or 10 years she sees herself as a very successful information technology consultant who plans to major in the filed of cloud computing and virtualization because she feels that is where technology is headed. She is hoping that the internship will equip her appropriately for the job market and enable her to grow her career.
The joy that comes with people embracing technology and being able to help someone with her IT skills inspires her.

loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.en:
Amen, who is currently running three businesses, is divorced with a boy and a girl who are in school. Her stationary business is a small registered firm and one of Amen's older businesses with high sales. Next is a retail shop, and the last is a beauty salon. Amen has been in these businesses for ten years now and is able to make a very good monthly profits. 

This will be her second loan from Kiva's partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loan to buy more printing papers, books of more types and other stationary items. Amen has managed to pay back her entire previous loan successfully. She used her profits to build a house and pay school fees and household expenses. She will use this loan to restock her stationary with more books, printer inks and papers and missing beauty salon equipment. Amen dreams that one day, she will be able to open a big stationary company. 

She will share this loan with her loan group " Tumaini" which consists of two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock her stationary with more books, printer inks, and papers, and missing beauty salon equipment

loans.name: Patricia Natalia

texts.es: Doña Patricia tiene 58 años de edad, se gana la vida alquilando cuartos de su vivienda. Es soltera y no tiene hijos. Solicita el crédito para invertirlo en su negocio, le hará mantenimiento a la pintura de su casa y los cuartos, y así poder mantener las mejores condiciones de vida de sus inquilinos, a quiénes ella considera parte de su familia, porqué son quiénes le hacen compañía diariamente.
texts.en: Patricia, 58, earns a living renting rooms at her home.  She is single and has no children.  She is requesting a loan to invest in her business by painting the rooms of her house.  This will make it more comfortable for her tenants whom she considers to be family since they keep her company on a daily basis.

loans.use: To buy paint for her house.

loans.name: Norma Margarita

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Jardín De La Artesanía se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Norma, tiene 61 años de edad, hace varios años su querido esposo falleció pero de esta relación tienen siete hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes.
Doña Norma trabaja en un Municipio de la localidad pero también tienre una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, cuando ella esta trabajando su hija es que se encarga de atender la tienda y su mamá le paga un sueldo mensual.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que es su forma de financiar su negocio y con sus ganancias salir adelante ella sola, ella compro más productos con los cuales ha ganado clientela ya que cada vez sus clientes encuentran lo que necesitan. Este crédito es para comprar víveres. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Su sueño es seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Jardín de la Artesanía" meets every 15 days in the Montecristi Canton, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and craft work on both a national and international level. The place is also known for its famous straw hat.

This is where Norma, 61, lives. A few years ago, her beloved husband passed away, but from this relationship she has seven children, who are already grown and independent. 

Norma works for the municipality but also has a small grocery store she runs from home.  When she is at work it is her daughter who takes care of the store.  Her mother pays her a monthly salary.

Norma is taking out another loan to finance the business so she can earn money to get ahead on her own.  By buying more products she has attracted more customers since they can find what they need.  This loan is to buy groceries.

She has been a member of the communal bank since the beginning and likes the help the loans give.  Her dream is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: To buy groceries.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine  is 30 years old and she is the eldest in a family of four.  Information technology is a gateway to a much improved life economically, socially and technologically. She has taken a loan of KES 85,000 to pay for an internship program at NetHope Academy. This will enable her to gain skills and experience in information technology, which will help her get a job.

In 5 or 10 years she sees herself mentoring young woman who have a passion for IT, as  well as owning a firm that offers forensic services in security and auditing.
She is inspired by the struggle and need to improve livelihoods of her community. She faced a challenge of demonstrations in university while studying for her degree. This was overcome through mobilization of students to form proper channels to air their grievances as well as ensure that feedback from school administrators was communicated efficiently.

loans.use: to pay for an internship program

loans.name: Laban

texts.en:
Laban is a 24-year-old married man. He has one child who is two years old. He describes himself to be a go-getter. He does farming to earn a living and has a motorcyle transport business to earn extra income. He describes his biggest business challenge to be a lack of finances to buy pumps and pipes. 

He will use the KES 85,000 loan to buy a water pump and pipes to pump water to his farm so that he can irrigate the crops. This will enable him to have sufficient water for irrigation. This will benefit his family of three and other friends of his family. He hopes that by doing irrigation, the economic situation of the family will change.

He hopes that in the future, he will use the maximum potential of his farmland. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water pump and pipes

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has one child who attends school. She operates a fruits and vegetables stall, which she has been doing for four years. She sells from home to her neighbors. 

Fatuma is requesting a loan from Yehu for 15,000 KES, which she will use to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to sell.
