She decided to join Yehu to get financial support. They live in their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. She hopes to establish a mini green grocer in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes, and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en: Linet is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself as determined and responsible. She operates a grocery store where she sells groceries. She describes her family challenge to be a shortage of water. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy gutters to install in her house so that she can harvest rain water. She hopes that in the future, she will have a reliable source of water. This is her fifth loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 40,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy gutters

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Magongo, which is a suburb in Mombasa, Kenya. She is 25 years old, and she is a single mother of one. She is a hawker and sells a items such as sunglasses, wallets and hairbands for women. She has been doing this business for the last one year. Right now, she doesn't have a permanent place to do business. She is asking for a loan to set up a stall where her customer can find her. 

She knew Milango through friends, and now she seeks a loan to rent a stall for her business. She hopes that in the next five years, her business will grow into being a supplier, and she will be able to employ people in the business. The major challenge in the business is the competition from other hawkers and the prices of commodities.

loans.use: to rent a stall to sell sunglasses, wallets, and hairbands

loans.name: Abdul Amir

texts.en:
Abdul Amir, a hardworking client from Iraq, is 46 years old, married and has three children. The sole provider for the family, Abdul Amir owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. Operating since 2004, he chose this field because he is well versed in it. He now has ample experience and enjoys a good reputation in his local community.

Abdul Amir is requesting a 3,000 USD loan to buy a motor generator to keep his products fresh and well refrigerated. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits in order to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motor generator to keep his products fresh and well refrigerated

loans.name: Kung

texts.en:
Kung, 56, is married with three dependent children. Her family lives in a house with a thatched roof located in Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district. The main sources of her family’s income are from farming rice, growing cassava and working for others for a fee. Having been in these businesses for almost 40 years, she is able to earn about 36,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

Kung received her first loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, five cycles ago and has effectively used it to sustain her family’s business and support her family’s needs. With a good business, she is applying for another loan of KHR 2,500,000 so as to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields to earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Saybali

texts.en:
Saybali is a 49-year-old married father of four children. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) who lives and works in an IDP settlement. His business is sheep breeding, a profitable and stable enterprise he has had for eleven years. Saybali buys lambs, raising and fattening them in four to five months, and then resells them for a profit in the local livestock bazaar. His monthly income is 180 AZN.

People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma, and always use yoghurt. Mutton is considered very healthy and enjoyed in everyday life. Fur is very useful for blankets and bed mattresses made by local women.

Saybali would like to increase his herd and so is requesting a loan of 2000 AZN to buy five sheep and one milking cow. This will be his second loan, and he has a good client history. In his previous loan, he didn't have a delinquency.

loans.use: to buy five sheep and one milking cow.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a 30-year-old hardworking woman with four children. She lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. Alice is a farmer but also has a retail shop to supplement her farming activities since farming is seasonal with unpredictable outputs. Her major business challenges include inadequate capital and price fluctuations. 

Alice is requesting a loan to buy tomatoes to plant. Her desire is to become a leading farmer.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes to plant

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 32 year old married woman with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda.

She sells agricultural  produce such as cassava and beans but also operates a salon in order to raise income to support her family. Inadequate capital and price fluctuation affect her profit projections. Her desire is to own a food store that can sustainably supply her customers all year round. She also has a milling machine (seen in the photo), which she uses to grind cassava into flour. Irene intends to use the loan to buy cassava to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava to sell

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en: Rhoda is 25 years old, married to Francis and blessed with two children aged eleven and six years. Rhoda runs a hotel business and small scale dairy farming business which she has been doing for the last three years, earning a monthly income of 12,500 Kenyan shillings (KES). She operates her business in Kipsembwa and is served by Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) Kapsabet office. She has borrowed 20,000 KES and plans to buy more food items for the hotel, namely, four bundles of flour and rice. She will use the profits from the business to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more food items for her hotel--four bundles of flour and rice

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en: Roselyne is 28 years old and married to Abraham and together they are blessed one child aged seven years. She has been in the hotel business for the last two years. Roselyne also does small scale dairy farming, from this businesses she gets a monthly income of Kshs. 23,000. She operates her business in Kipsembwo location, which is served by KADET Kapsabet office. She has borrowed a loan of 20,000 KES and plans to buy additional food items to sell in the hotel and also to buy tea leaves for resale. She will use the profits from the business to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy additional food items to sell in the hotel

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 45 years old, married and supports six members of her family. She runs a clothes-selling business in addition to doing horticulture farming in Kamobo. She is served by KADET's Kapsabet office. This has been her income-generating business for the last 20 years and she gets an average monthly income of KSHS 12,000. Hannah plans to use the loan of KSHS.30,000 to buy shirts, trousers, blouses and pullovers to sell. Her dream is to buy land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, blouses and pullovers to sell

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 55 years old from Olkalou. He is married to Hannah who is a businesswoman and they are blessed with six children aged 23, 20, 17, 13, 9 and 5 years old.

He has been in the farming business for the last five years, growing crops like maize, wheat, beans, kale and potatoes. John has applied for his third loan of KES 10,000 from Kadet Ltd which will be used to buy fertilizer and potato tubers for planting.

His monthly income right now is KES 25,000 and his intention is to use the profits from his expanded business to educate three of his children who are schooling and to boost his wife's business.

His hopes and dreams for his future business and family are to be successful.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and potato tubers for planting

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen has a hotel business and has been running it for 18 years now. He is 45 years old and married. Together with his spouse, they have been blessed with three children. His spouse also provides additional income.

He plans to use this loan to pay for the installation of electricity in his parents' home. This will be his seventh loan term, and he paid his previous loans successfully.

In the future, Stephen hopes to give a good eduction to his children.

loans.use: To install electricity in his parents' home.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is 53 years old and married to Jane. They have been blessed with six children.

He is a farmer and he has been in business for eight years and right now his monthly income is KES 40,000.

He is borrowing a loan of KES 80,000 to boost his business by buying fertilisers and more seedlings for planting. Elijah will use the anticipated profit from the business to support his family. 

This is his fourth loan and he successfully paid his previous loans. His hope is to expand his business.

loans.use: To boost his business by buying fertilisers and more seedlings for planting

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
Vincent is 28 years old, married to Dorothy, and they are blessed with one child, aged 2 years old. He has been operating his small business of selling secondhand clothing for the last four years.

He specializes mainly in selling skirts. This business has been fetching a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES). To enable him to increase his sales, he knows that he has to increase his stock. This will be made possible by the loan of 30,000 KES, which he has applied for from KADET Ltd. This is his second loan cycle.

He hopes to use the profits realized from his expanded business to start a business for his spouse and to pay back his loan to KADET Ltd.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of secondhand clothes to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Rosario Elizabeth

texts.es:
Rosario es una señora de 60 años de edad, casada; tiene 3 hijos  todos ellos casados; ella vive en  La Aldea La Ladrillera, San Pablo Jocopilas, Suchitepéquez.
Ella se dedica a la venta de café y esto lo realiza en su comunidad; a ella le gusta esta actividad porque además de generarle ingresos la mantiene ocupada y la hace sentirse útil a la sociedad; cuenta que también recibe una pensión del seguro social porque su esposo ya falleció y estos ingresos le ayudan a cubrir sus gastos mensuales. Por otro lado también realiza la labor de niñera en su comunidad, actividad que también le generan otros pequeños ingresos. Ella tiene más de 25 años de experiencia en la actividad de venta de café.
Ella solicita un préstamo de Q 6,000.00 para compra de materiales para realizarle acabados a su vivienda.
Rosario sueña con terminar de construir su casa y comprar más terrenos para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosario is 60 years old and was married. She has 3 children who are all married and lives in the village of La Ladrillera, San Pablo Jocopilas, Suchitepéquez.

Rosario makes a living selling coffee and does this in her community. She likes this job because apart from providing her with an income it keeps her occupied and makes her feel useful to society. She says she also receives a social security pension as her husband has died and these sources of income help her to cover her monthly costs. At the same time she works as a childminder in her community, which also gives her a bit more income. She has more than 25 years' experience selling coffee. 

Rosario is asking for a loan of Q 6,000 to buy materials to finish off her home. She dreams of finishing building her home and buying more land for her children.

loans.use: to buy materials to finish building her home.

loans.name: Carmen Marina

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Jardín De La Artesanía se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 63 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, una de ellos  aún vive con ella. Su esposo tiene un taller que arregla zapatos.
Doña Carmen se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa donde tiene un pequeño local, deja a crédito a sus clientes y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene 9 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito, sus ganancias las empleó para gastos en su hogar y para mejorar su local, su negocio como siempre se mantiene muy bien ya que cuenta con muy buena clientela. Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan los créditos para salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener un gran local.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Jardín De La Artesanía" meets every fortnight in the canton of Montecristi. This area is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its handicrafts, which are well-known at the national and international level, because this is where the famous "Panama" straw hats are made. This is where Carmen, 63, lives. She is married, and she and her husband have three grown children, one of whom, a daughter, still lives with her. Her husband has a workshop where he repairs shoes. Carmen has a business selling all types of clothing. She sells door-to-door as well as from her home, where she has a small shop. She sells on credit to her customers, collecting every fortnight. She goes to buy her merchandise in Guayaquil every time she needs it. She's had this business for 9 years. 

Carmen is asking for another loan. She will use her profits to cover her household expenses and to improve her shop. Her business is running well, as always, since she has a very good clientele. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise, such as: pants, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing. She's been a member of her communal bank from the start, and she likes it because of the help that  these loans always give her to make progress in life. Carmen's dream is to have a big store.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, T-shirts and children's clothing

loans.name: Sherley Alexandra

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Esperanza De los Bajos.
En este lugar vive la señora Shirley, tiene 19 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre y está en su séptimo mes de embarazo. El marido trabaja en la refinería. Ella estudia Terapia Ocupacional en una universidad en Manta
Doña Shirley además de estudiar  y con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta  para cubrir sus gastos de estudios se  dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta recorriendo su localidad y también vende en la universidad donde estudia, ella  deja a crédito y que cobra cada ocho días, lleva más de dos años en este negocio.  
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y otras prendas. Lleva 3 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños aumentar más su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Esperanza De Los Bajos" communal bank meets every fortnight in Los Bajos of Montecristi, a city known for its rich diversity of typical products such as the 'Panama' hats which are famous nationally and internationally. This is where Shirley lives. She is 19 years old, has a partner and is seven months pregnant. Her husband works at the refinery. 

Shirley is studying Occupational Therapy at a university in Manta Doña. As well as studying, Shirley sells all sorts of clothing, with the aim of earning some money herself to cover her study costs. She sells door-to-door in her own neighbourhood and also sells at the university where she is studying. She gives her customers credit and collects payment every week. She has been running this business for more than two years. 

Shirley will use the loan to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, t-shirts and other items of clothing. She has had 3 loans from the Communal Bank and likes it because of the help the loans give her. Her dream is to increase her business further.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, t-shirts and other items of clothing.

loans.name: Magdalena Trinidad

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Esperanza De los Bajos.
En este lugar vive la señorita Magdalena, tiene 27 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres, Lleva años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan para salir adelante.
Doña Magdalena la finalidad de salir adelante se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo y productos naturales de la marca Garden, ella con la ayuda de su mamá salen a recorrer por toda la localidad ofreciendo sus productos,  tiene muchos clientes que siempre le compran sus prendas y mucho más los productos naturales ya que son tratamientos continuos, ella deja a crédito y que cobra cada 8 días. 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y  productos naturales. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The "Nueva Esperanza De Los Bajos" communal bank meets every fortnight in Los Bajos of Montecristi, a city known for its rich diversity of typical products such as the 'Panama' hats which are famous nationally and internationally. This is where Magdalena lives. She is 27 years old, is single and lives in her parents' house. She has been in the Communal Bank for years and likes it because of the help it gives them to get on in life. 

In order to make progress, Magdalena makes a living selling all sorts of clothing and natural products from the Garden brand. With her mum's help she goes all around her local area offering her products for sale. She has a lot of customers who always buy her clothing and much more so the natural products since these are ongoing treatments. Magdalena sells on credit and collects payments every week. 

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as trousers, blouses, t-shirts and natural products. Her dream is to get on in life.

loans.use: to buy trousers, blouses, t-shirts and natural products.

loans.name: Dorys Jacinta

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Esperanza De los Bajos.
En este lugar vive la señora Dorys, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 22, 18 y 15 años  de edad, los dos menores aun viven con ella, el menor estudia en colegio. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Dorys con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo aunque lo que más vende es la ropa interior, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan alguna prenda,  ella sale a recorrer tres días por semana, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad la cual empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Lleva dos años  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan los créditos para salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener un gran local.
texts.en:
In the community of Los Bajos near Montecristi, a city known for a great variety of typical products such as the toquilla straw hats (also known as Panama hats) known within the country and beyond, the members of the Communal Bank Nueva Esperanza De Los Bajos (New Hope of Los Bajos) meet every 15 days. Dorys, 42 years old, lives there. She is married and has three children from her marriage, aged 22, 18, and 15. The two younger ones still live with her, and the youngest is in school. Her husband is a driver.

With the intent to make some money herself that she can use to get ahead and to help her husband with the household expenses, Dorys works selling clothing of all types. The item she sells the most of, however, is underclothing. Her method of sales is going door-to-door, as well as selling out of her house, where her clients will come when they need an item. She goes out to sell three days a week, sells to her clients on credit and collects the money every 15 days. She goes to Guayaquil to buy merchandise whenever she needs it. Dorys has been working this way for two years; she began with her first loan from the communal bank. 

She will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing. She has been part of the communal bank for two years, and she likes it because of the help that the loans always give her to move forward. Her dream is to have a large store.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, shirts, and children's clothing

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
Luis tiene cuarenta y cinco años de edad, es casado tiene dos hijos, viven en casa propia en un sector rural de la ciudad de Latacunga, este sector se llama José Guango Bajo sector conocido por ser una zona ganadera y láctea, en la provincia de Cotopaxi perteneciente a la república del Ecuador.
Luis por falta de recursos económicos de sus padre Luis solo pudo terminar la primaria, pero esto no ha sido obstáculo para ponerse a trabajar es Chofer Profesional, y actualmente tiene un taxi propio legalmente constituido, su esposa se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores. Son una pareja muy trabajadora y han sacado a sus hijos adelante a pesar de las dificultades que se les han presentado.
Luis requiere un crédito para invertir en la reparación y matriculación de su vehículo, con el tiempo le gustaría comprarse uno nuevo. Ellos agradecen a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Luis is 45 years old and is married with two children. They live in their own house in a rural area of the city of Latacunga. The area is called José Guango Bajo and is known as a cattle and dairy farming region. It is in the province of Cotopaxi, part of the republic of Ecuador.

Since Luis's father had limited income, Luis was only able to finish his primary education. However, this has not been an obstacle to him in setting himself up to work as a Professional Driver and he now has his own legally registered taxi. His wife earns a living rearing and selling small animals. They are a very hard-working couple and they have brought their children up well in spite of the difficulties they have faced.

Luis needs a loan in order to repair and register his vehicle. In time he would like to buy a new one. They are grateful to Fundación Alternativa in Ecuador and to Kiva for making this improvement in their work and personal life possible.

loans.use: to repair and register his vehicle.

loans.name: Edita Guillermina

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Esperanza De los Bajos.
En este lugar vive la señora Edita, tiene 57 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos todos mayores de edad. El marido es jornalero. 
Doña Edita con la ayuda de su marido hace varios años construyo un pequeño galpón para la cría de pollos, ella empezó con uno de los créditos que recibió del banco y así mismo con cada uno que ha recibido ah ido aumentando su negocio, empezó con menos de 100 pollos y ahora mete hasta 200 pollos por temporada, ella los tiene por tres meses y luego los entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta el lugar. Lleva tres años realizando esta actividad con la cual salen adelante ya que su marido gana muy poco en sus faenas en el campo.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para los mismos  para que estos tengan un buen desarrollo. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan los créditos para salir adelante. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
In Los Bajos near Montecristi, a city known for its great variety of typical products such as the toquilla straw hats (also known as Panama hats) known within the country and beyond, the members of the communal bank Nueva Esperanza De Los Bajos (New Hope of Los Bajos) meet every 15 days. This is where Edita lives. She is 57 years old and in a common-law marriage from which she has five children, all adults. Her husband is a day labourer.

Several years ago, Edita built, with her husband's help, a small shed for raising chickens. She began with a loan she recieved from the bank, and so with each one she has recieved she has continued to grow her business. She began with fewer than 100 chickens and now she gets up to 200 chickens a season. She keeps them for three months and then turns them over to traders who come to the place. She has been doing this for three years, and is helps them to get ahead as her husband doesn´t make very much in his field jobs. 

She will use this loan to buy chickens as well as feed and medicine for them so that they grow up well. She has been with the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because of the help the loans always are to her in getting ahead. Her dream is to keep moving forward.

loans.use: to buy chickens, as well as feed and medicine for them

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is a youth client from Iraq. He is 21 years old and married but has no children yet. Adel is the only provider for his family. Adel is a barber. After previously working for two years as an employee at a barber shop, Adel established his own business in 2010 and has been gradually gaining much experience in this field. Now, Adel has an employee and is well-known in his surrounding area. 

Adel is requesting a youth loan of 3,000 USD. He will use this loan to renovate his barber shop and to buy and install an air conditioner in his shop. In the future, Adel is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so that he will be able to open a bigger barber shop and attract more customers.

loans.use: to renovate his barber shop and to buy and install an air conditioner in his shop

loans.name: Ocomistu Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “OCOMISTU”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sandra es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche, servicio de albañil, venta de zapatos, venta de comida, costura de chamarras, macramé de mantas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sandra es integrante, ella indica que hace dos ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de lechería; este negocio lo inicio conjuntamente su familia, ya que desde niña trabaja con este producto, cuando se casó decide emprender su propio espacio de comercialización.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de vaca) que adquirirá de las ferias comunales cercanas a su domicilio y posteriormente a la crianza lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal association “OCOMISTU”  will be starting its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Focal Point of  Panamericana. It is made up of nine members and is run by a board of directors of which Sandra is the treasurer. The businesses which the members of the communal association run are varied and among them are:  milk sales, bricklaying, shoe sales, food sales, sewing jackets and making macrame blankets. 

The loan they will take out will benefit small businesswomen of which Sandra is a member. She says she joined Pro Mujer two cycles ago after being invited by a promoter from the institution who went to visit her in her home.

Currently she has a dairy business. She started this business jointly with her family, as she had worked with this product since being a child. When she got married she decided to have her own sales place.

The loan she will take out now is to increase capital to buy a cow which she will buy at the community markets near to her home, then after rearing it she will sell it at her sales place. This type of work helps her to generate income to support her home as much as possible, since she is married and has 3 children. When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the health area.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Yanaptasiñani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “YANAPTASIÑANI”  iniciará el décimo tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alicia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de mantas, venta de comida, venta de pescado frito, ayudante de albañil, venta de ropa, venta de calzados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alicia es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una compañera que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de mantas; este negocio lo inicio conjuntamente su familia, ya que desde niña trabaja con este producto, cuando se casó decide emprender su propio espacio de comercialización.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana e hilo) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud, capacitación y crédito.
texts.en:
The communal association “YANAPTASIÑANI” will be starting its thirteenth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Focal Point of Panamericana. It is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors of which Alicia is the president. The businesses which the members of the communal association run are varied and among them are: selling blankets, food sales, selling fried fish, bricklayer's assistant, clothing sales and sales of footwear.

The loan they will take out will benefit small businesswomen of which Alicia is a member. She says she joined Pro Mujer four cycles ago after being invited by a friend who is a member of the institution.

Currently she has a business weaving and selling blankets. She started this business jointly with her family, as she had worked with this product since being a child. When she got married she decided to have her own sales outlet.

The loan she will take out now is to increase capital to buy wool and thread which she will buy at the markets in the city of El Alto, then after making the blankets she will sell them at her sales outlet. This type of work helps her to generate income to support her home as much as possible, since she lives with her partner and has 3 children. 

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the health area, the training and the loans.

loans.use: to buy wool and thread.

loans.name: Chicas Azucar X Siempre Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CHICAS AZUCAR POR SIEMPRE” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Felipa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: artesanía en madera, venta de verduras, pollerera, venta de EBEL, venta de detergentes, carpintería, taller de costurera y venta de muebles.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Felipa es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su domicilio. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de baúles; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su esposo, ya que él realiza estos productos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de madera) que adquirirá de las barracas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la fabricación lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
Communal bank “Chicas Azúcar por siempre” [Sugar Girls Forever] will start its first cycle with Pro Mujer, in the satellite office of Los Andes. It is composed of eight members and run by a board where Felipa is the president. The members have different activities, such as making wooden handicrafts, selling vegetables, raising chickens, selling cosmetics, selling detergents, a carpentry, a sewing workshop and selling furniture.

This loan will be beneficial for small micro entrepreneurs such as Felipa. She has been working with Pro Mujer for six years, invited by a representative from the institution that paid her a visit. At the moment, she sells chests (furniture), a business she learned from her husband, who makes these products.

This loan will help her increase her working capital. She will buy wood at the warehouses of La Paz and produce upon request. This activity helps her maintain her family, since she is married and has a son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the Health Care services.

loans.use: to buy wood to make chests.

loans.name: Luciernagas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LUCIERNAGAS” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nancy es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de deportivos, venta de ropa americana, venta de deportivos, venta de awayos, servicio de bordados computarizados, venta de muebles, venta de chamarras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nancy es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de costura de ropa deportiva; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio con un poco capital que tenían su esposo y ella al casarse.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de tela) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a  la elaboración lo comercializará en otros departamentos de Bolivia. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud.
texts.en:
Luciérnagas Communal Bank will start its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Regional Office.  It's made up of eight members governed by a board of directors of which Nancy's the president.  The bank members carry out a variety of businesses, including sewing athletic clothing, sales of clothing from the United States, athletic clothing sales, multicolored cloth sales, computerized embroidery, furniture sales, and coat sales.

The loan they're getting will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Nancy.  She says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two years, having joined on the invitation of a friend who's a member.  Currently Nancy has a tailoring business making athletic clothing.  She says she started this business with a little bit of capital she and her husband had when they got married.

Nancy's getting the loan to increase her capital by buying fabric from the wholesale stores in the city of El Alto.  After production, she'll sell her clothing in other departments in Bolivia.  This job allows Nancy to generate income to support her family, because she's married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says the training and the health field.

loans.use: to buy fabric

loans.name: Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HORMIGUITAS”  iniciará el décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de German Busch, está compuesta por doce  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Faustina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de condimentos, venta de refrescos, venta de regalos, venta de juguetes, confección de centros, venta de CD’s, tejido de polainas, carpintería, elaboración de tucumanas, tejido de medias, venta de calzados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Faustina es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación su cuñada que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de carpintería; este negocio lo emprendió hace quince años atrás, conjuntamente su esposo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de madera) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a su elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones con sus compañeras y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
Hormiguitas Communal Bank will start its tenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Germán Busch Regional Office.  It's made up of 12 members governed by a board of directors of which Faustina's the president.  The bank members carry out a variety of businesses, including food sales, spice sales, beverage sales, gift sales, toy sales, making centerpieces, CD sales, knitting leggings, carpentry, making "tucumanas" [traditional turnovers], knitting socks, and shoe sales.

The loan they're getting will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Faustina.  She says she has been a member of Pro Mujer for eight years, having joined on the invitation of her sister-in-law, who's a member of the institution.  Currently Faustina has a carpentry business that she and her husband started 15 years ago.

Faustina's getting this loan to increase her capital by buying wood from the wholesale stores in the city of El Alto.  After production she'll sell her products in her sals stall.  This job allows Faustina to generate income to support her household to the extent possible, because she's married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer she says the meetings with her friends and the training.

loans.use: to buy wood

loans.name: Caminantes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CAMINANTES”  iniciará el octavo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ignacia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de fruta, venta de detergente, venta de rellenos, venta de refresco y gelatina, tejido de chompas y mantas, venta de comida

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ignacia es integrante, ella indica que hace seis años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; este negocio lo instalo al observar la necesidad de sus vecinos de contar con un espacio de compra y actualmente lleva diez años en este negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el mejoramiento de su ambiente (compra de ladrillos y cemento) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo implementará en la ampliación del negocio. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The “CAMINANTES” communal bank will start its eighth cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Collpani center. It is made up of eight members and is led by a board of directors of which Ignacia is the president. The business that the members of the communal bak have are varied. Among them are selling fruit, selling detergent, selling filling, selling beverages and gelatin, knitting sweaters and blankets and selling food. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, including Ignacia. She indicates that she has been in Pro Mujer for six years, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Right now, she has a business which a a neighborhood store. She started this business when she saw that her neighbors needed a place to make their purchases, and she has had this business for ten years. 

The loan she will take out now is to improve her space by buying bricks and cement that she will acquire in stores in the city of El Alto. Later she will use this to expand her business. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her home as much as possible, as she is married and has three children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the trainings about health and credit.

loans.use: to buy bricks and cement.

loans.name: Union Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIÓN”  iniciará el décimo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nancy es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de carne, costura de enaguas, venta de ropa, venta de periódicos, venta de batidos, venta de cosméticos, venta de fibra de vidrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nancy es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una tía que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de verduras; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió hace años, ya que trabajaba en un ingenio, posteriormente decide implementar su propio espacio de venta.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de verduras) que adquirirá de ingenios mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en salud.
texts.en:
The "Unión" communal bank will begin its tenth loan cycle through the Santiago II regional office.  This communal bank is made up of eight members and is managed by a board of directors, which has Nancy as its treasurer.  The members have various businesses, including: selling vegetables, selling meat,  making petticoats, selling clothes, selling newspapers, selling milkshakes, selling make-up, and selling glass fibres.

This loan will benefit small businesses in Nancy's communal bank.  Nancy tells us that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago following an invitation from an aunt, who is a member of the communal bank.  Nancy has a business selling vegetables.  She tells us that she started the business years ago. She used to work in a mill but later decided to start her own business.

This loan will used to increase Nancy's capital, by buying vegetables from one of the city's wholesalers markets in La Paz.  Nancy will then sell on these products. This work allows Nancy to earn the money to support her household as best as possible - she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Nancy responds by saying she likes the health education which is provided.

loans.use: to buy vegetables.

loans.name: Las Rosas Del Tolar Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS ROSAS DEL TOLAR”  Iniciarán el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Presidenta Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de leche y producción de papa.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lidia es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una vecina que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de producción de papa y venta de leche; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió trabajando desde niña con sus padres quienes le enseñaron estos oficios.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de vaca) que adquirirá de los las comunidades cercanas a su domicilio  y posteriormente a la crianza lo comercializará la leche en  su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro que se realiza.
texts.en:
The "Las Rosas del Tolar" communal bank will begin its fourth loan cycle through the Patacamaya regional office.  This communal bank is made up of eight members and is managed by a board of directors, which has Lidia as its president.  The members have various businesses, including: selling milk, and growing potatoes.

This loan will benefit small businesses in Lidia's communal bank.  Lidia tells us that she joined Pro Mujer four years ago following an invitation from a neighbour, who is a member of the communal bank.  Lidia has a business growing potatoes and selling milk.  She tells us that she learned this trade from her parents from a young age.  

This loan will used to increase Lidia's capital, by buying a dairy cow from one of the nearby communities. Lidia will raise the cow and sell the milk.  This work allows Lidia to earn the money to support her household as best as possible - Lidia is married and has one son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Lidia responds by saying she likes the savings that she makes.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Union Progreso Y Trabajo Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “UNIÓN PROGRESO Y TRABAJO” iniciará el décimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Enriqueta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pescado, venta de chamarras, agencia de pollos, venta de comida, comerciante de deportivos, técnico de celulares, tienda de barrio, venta de queso.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Enriqueta es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de servicio de cocina; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio al trabajar en otro lugar donde ella realizaba servicio de cocina.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ollas) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a  la elaboración de sus productos lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene diez hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la amistad que tienen con las compañeras y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The "Unión progreso y trabajo" communal bank will begin its tenth loan cycle through the Los Andes regional office.  This communal bank is made up of eight members and is managed by a board of directors, which has Enriqueta as its president.  The members have various businesses, including: selling fish, blankets, food, and cheese; a chicken business, sports business, a mobile phone technician, and a grocery store.

This loan will benefit small businesses in Enriqueta's communal bank.  Enriqueta tells us that she joined Pro Mujer following an invitation from a friend, who is a member of the communal bank.  Enriqueta has a business selling meals.  She tells us that she started this business elsewhere, where she worked as a cook.

This loan will used to increase Enriqueta's capital, by buying pots and pans from one of the city's wholesalers markets in La Paz. Enriqueta will then use them to prepare her meals to sell at her stall. This work allows Enriqueta to earn money to support her household as best as possible - she is married and has ten children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Nancy responds by saying she likes the friendship that she has with colleagues, as well as the health benefits.

loans.use: to buy pots and pans.

loans.name: Cielo Azul Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “CIELO AZUL” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosario es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: costura de polleras, licorería, artesanía en trajes flokloricos, tienda de barrio, operador de tractor, venta de zapatillas, venta de estufas, venta de salchipapas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosario es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de taller de costura; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su familia, ya que desde niña ella ayudaba en el mismo, cuando tuvo su primer hijo decide establecer su propio taller.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de telas) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a  la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito rápido.
texts.en:
The “CIELO AZUL” communal bank will start its third cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Los Andes center. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors of which Rosario is the president. The business that the members of the communal bank have are varied. Among them are sewing skirts, a liquor store, traditional handmade clothing, a neighborhood store, a tractor operator, selling heaters, and selling sausage and french fries. 

The loan they will take out now will benefit the micro-businesswomen, including Rosario. She indicates that she has been in Pro Mujer for two years, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Right now, she has a sewing business. She says that she learned the business from her family, because since she was a child she helped do this activity. When she had her first son, she decided to open her own shop.
 
The loan she will take out now is to raise capital by buying fabric that she will acquire in wholesale shops in the city of El Alto. After production she will sell to order. This work allows her to generate resources to support her family, as she is single and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes that the loans are quick.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Las Luminosas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS LUMINOSAS”  Iniciarán el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Flora es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, tejido de macramé, costura de polleras, fábrica de ladrillos, tienda de barrio, tejido de chompas, cocinera.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Flora es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad él tiene un negocio de elaboración de comida; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años atrás, ya que necesitaba un medio de generar recursos.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, aceite, fideo, enlatados) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito que se ofrece.
texts.en:
The “LAS LUMINOSAS” communal bank will start its third cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Villa Adela center. It is made up of eight members and led by a board of directors of which Flora is the secretary. The businesses that the members have are varied. Among them are selling food, doing macramé, sewing skirts, making bricks, a neighborhood store, knitting sweaters, and cooking. 

The loan they will take out now will benefit the micro-businesswomen, including Flora. She indicates that she has been in Pro Mujer, joining at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Right now, she she has a business making food. She says that she learned this business on her own initiative several years ago, because she needed a way to generate income. 
 
The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital by buying rice, oil, pasta and canned goods that she will acquire from wholesale shops in the city of El Alto. After preparation, she will sell her food in her sales space. This work allows her to generate income to support her home, as she is married and has two children.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the loans it offers.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, pasta and canned goods.

loans.name: Love Ii Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Love II” group from Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, to apply for a loan of 500,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each. With the help of this loan they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and consequently, improve their living conditions. 

Sallay is the featured leader of this group. The 38-year-old is married to a tailor, and they have one child who is attending primary school. Sallay has been a businesswoman for 10 years now. She sells dishes, bowls, etc. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy a lot of dishes, bowls, etc., to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a lot of dishes, bowls, etc., to add to her current stock

loans.name: Mirqasim

texts.en:
Mirqasim is 36 years of age. He is a married person. He has two kids. Mirqasim is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income for the family. For five years, he has grown fruits and vegetables in his yard and sold them in the bazaar. In this business, his wife also helps him, and from this business his monthly profit is 100 AZN [Azerbaijani New Manat].

In Azerbaijan, fruit is in very high demand and people like to eat fresh fruit a lot. Besides his fruit he also sells flowers. Mirqasim is really optimistic about the future, regarding the expansion of his business, in order to raise the standard of living of his family. He needs to buy new farming supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and fruit trees.

For this purpose, he has applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN. He thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy new farming supplies such as seeds, fertilizers and fruit trees.

loans.name: Las Flores De Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS FLORES DE NUEVO AMANECER”  Iniciarán el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Susana es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de carne, elaboración de mantas, venta de polleras, venta de muebles usados, costura, venta de celulares, venta de verduras, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Susana es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia hace varios años atrás, ya que necesitaba un medio de generar recursos y este producto es el que se vende con mayor frecuencia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, aceite, fideo, enlatados) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene siete hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta compartir con el equipo.
texts.en:
The group Las Flores de Nuevo Amanecer [The Flowers of the New Dawn] will begin its fourth loan cycle with the nonprofit Pro Mujer as part of the village bank “Centro Focal de Villa Adela”. The group is made up of eight members and is led by a board of governors, where Susana is the Secretary. 
The businesses of the members of the communal bank are varied, and include selling meat, making blankets, selling typical skirts, selling used furniture, dressmaking, selling mobile phones, selling vegetables and selling food.

The loan they will take out will benefit small-scale businesswomen, one of whom is Susana. She states that a year ago she joined Pro Mujer through the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling food. She says that she started this business on her own initiative several years before, because she needed a way of generating income, and this product is the one that sells most often.
 
The loan she is now taking out is to grow her capital by buying rice, oil, noodles and canned goods through the wholesale shops in El Alto. After production, she will sell her product at her food stall. This form of work enables her to generate income to maintain her household as far as possible, since she is married and has seven children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she enjoys sharing with the team.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, noodles and canned food.

loans.name: Mayas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MAYAS”  iniciará el décimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Jhovana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: confección de prendas, tejido de lana, venta de repuesto de cocina, venta de carteras, venta de dulces, carpintera, tienda de barrio, tejido de chompas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Jhovana es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una compañera que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad él tiene un negocio de taller de costura; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres quienes tienen un taller de costura, mismo que ella decide copiar cuando se casó.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el espacio de venta (compra tienda) que adquirirá de una galería en la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo establecerá como espacio comercial. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones.
texts.en:
The communal association "MAYAS" is going to start its tenth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Villa Tejada. It has ten members and is led by a management team where Jhovana is the president. The businesses that the members run are varied: dressmaking, wool, sale of kitchen replacements, sale of purses, sale of candy, carpentry, grocery store, sweater making, etc. 

The loan will benefit small microentrepreneurs, Jhovana among them. She has been part of Pro Mujer for five years, after being invited by a colleague who is a member of the institution. She has a dressmaking studio, a business that she learned from her parents and decided to replicate when she got married. She will use the loan to buy retail space from a gallery in the city of El Alto. This will allow her to generate enough resources to support her household, as she is married and has one child. 

When she is asked about what she likes in Pro Mujer, she says she enjoys the meetings.

loans.use: to buy retail space.

loans.name: Pomamaya Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “POMAMAYA”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, tienda de abarrotes, producción de leche, tejido de mantas, venta de ganado.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una Asesora de la institución que le fue a visitar a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche; este negocio lo heredo de sus padres hace cinco años, ya que ella será la responsable del mismo.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ternero) que adquirirá de las comunidades aledañas a la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo criará para comercializar los productos lácteos en las empresas. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las garantías reducidas y el servicio de salud.
texts.en:
The communal association “POMAMAYA” will begin its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer (For Women) as part of the "Centro Focal de Panamericana" communal bank. The group is comprised of eight members and is governed by a Board of Directors and María, their Secretary. 

The members of the communal association work in a variety of businesses including: selling food, a grocery store, milk production, weaving blankets, and selling cattle. The loan will benefit these small business owners, including María. She explains that she joined Pro Mujer (For Women) three years ago at the invitation of a representative of the institution who paid her a visit at home. She currently runs a business selling milk. She inherited this business from her parents five years ago, because she is in charge of it. 

The loan will be used to increase resources; to buy calves from communities in the city of El Alto. She will then raise the calves to sell dairy products. This type of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her home as best she can. She is single and has four children. 

When people ask her why she likes Pro Mujer (For Women), her answer is that she likes the reduced rates of insurance and the health services.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 53 years old and lives in Alindahaw, Tukuran, ZDS. She is married with two children.

Luzviminda has a store; she has this business for 15 years. She requested a loan to purchase additional inventory for her sari-sari (convenience) store.

Luzviminda has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Luzviminda hopes to have her own grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is married with four children. Venus is 48 years old and lives in Pagadian, Philippines.

Venus is a farmer and grows bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for 12 years. She requested a loan to buy fertilizer.

Venus has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Venus hopes to have a rice mill.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 37 years old. She is married and has two grade-school-age children. She lives in Pob. Sibutad, Zamboanga del Norte. 

Joyce has engaged in a sari-sari [convenience] store business for five years and earns a monthly income of 4,500 PHP [Philippines pesos]. Her husband is a farmer to sustain their daily consumption needs. 

Joyce requested a new loan to purchase various groceries to sell to customers. She has been a CUMI member of Paglaum MPC for five years. She dream of having more savings for future use.

loans.use: To purchase various groceries for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Ulda Manuela

texts.es:
La Señora Ulda  forma parte del grupo de crédito Génesis desde hace un año y medio, tiempo en el que ha logrado establecer una muy buena amistad con todas las integrantes del grupo ya que son más que una familia que se apoya incondicionalmente. Vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es la tercera ciudad de mayor importancia económica del país, desde Diciembre de 1999 es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, cuenta con grande paisajes naturales, una variedad en su fauna, es cuna de grandes artistas y deportistas.
La Señora Ulda tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 14 y 4 años de edad, su primer hijo estudia en el colegio su esposo es de profesión Abogado, la casa en la que viven es prestada de unos familiares.
Doña Ulda trabaja como cajera desde hace 2 años en turnos rotativos, en su tiempo libre se dedica a la venta de una gran variedad de cosméticos. 
Su crédito va a invertir en la compra de cosméticos para navidad. Su meta es de culminar sus estudios Universitarios.
texts.en:
Ulda has been a part of the Génesis credit group for a year and a half. During that time, she has been able to establish a very good friendship with all of the members of the group. They are more like a family that supports each other unconditionally. She lives on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. This city is the third most important economically in the country. Since December of 1999 it has been a World Heritage Site. It has great natural landscapes, a variety of fauna, and is the cradle of great artists and athletes. 

Ulda is 36 years old. She is married and has two children from her marriage, aged 14 and 4. Her oldest child goes to high school. Her husband is a lawyer by profession and the house they live in was lent to them by a relative. Ulda has worked as a cashier for 2 years on rotating shifts. In her free time, she sells a variety of cosmetics. She is going to invest in buying cosmetics for Christmas. Her goals is to finish college.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 23 years old. He is single and lives with his parents and his two young brothers. Ahmad and his father provide the family's income together. Ahmad is a very active person. He owns a small workplace where he sells cereals and grains. He is both a wholesaler and a retailer. Ahmad established his business in 2010 and has become well-known in the market. He has earned an excellent reputation, thanks to his affordable prices.

Ahmad is requesting a youth loan of $3,000 in order to renovate his workplace, install an external ceiling and buy more goods to sell. Ahmad plans to continue earning his family's living by expanding his business. He hopes that this loan will attract more customers to him, which will result in an increase of his profits.

loans.use: to renovate his workplace, install an external ceiling and buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Mariamu

texts.en: Mariamu is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be industrious. She operates a tailoring shop where she makes and repairs clothes. She describes her biggest challenge to be water shortage. She will use the 8,700 KES [Kenyan shillings] loan to buy a 1,000-liter water tank to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that, in the future, she will build a business premises. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a 1000-liter water tank

loans.name: El Paraiso Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “EL PARAISO”  iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Teodora es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida rápida, venta de cosméticos, venta de ollas, librería, tejido de mantas, comerciante de ají, elaboración de cuadernos, preparación de cola para madera.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Teodora es integrante, ella indica que hace cuatro años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ají; este negocio lo aprendió de su madre a quien ayudaba desde niña, cuando tuvo su primer hijo decide asumir el mismo negocio independientemente.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ají) que adquirirá de las ferias de Bolivia y Perú y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud.
texts.en:
The communal association "EL PARAISO" is going to start its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Villa Tejada. It has eight members and is led by a management team where Teodora is the president. The businesses that the members run are varied: sale of fast food, sale of cosmetics, sale of pots, bookstore, blanket making, sale of bell pepper, notebook making, glue making, etc. 

The loan will benefit small microentrepreneurs, Teodora among them. She has been part of Pro Mujer for four years, after being invited by a colleague who is a member of the institution. She sells bell peppers, a business that she learned from her mother, whom she helped when she was a kid. When she had her first child, she decided to continue with the same business independently. 

She will use the loan to invest in capital (buy bell peppers) in fairs in Bolivia and Perú. She will then sell it at her grocery store. This allows her to generate enough resources to support her household, as she is single and has one child.

When she is asked about what she likes in Pro Mujer, she says she likes the area of health.

loans.use: to buy bell pepper.

loans.name: Rocio De La Mañana Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROCIO DE LA MAÑANA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Tejada, está compuesta por trece integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marisabel es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chuño y papa, venta de batido, venta de abarrotes, contratista, venta de zapatos, comerciante, venta de ropa, ferretería, venta de sanwichs de pollo, venta de salteñas, venta de abarrotes, venta de pollo.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marisabel es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una compañera que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad él tiene un negocio de venta de pollo; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su anterior trabajo, donde trabajaba de empleada de venta.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el espacio de venta (compra pollos por mayor) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las reuniones de pago porque le gustan las personas.
texts.en:
The “ROCIO DE LA MAÑANA” communal association will begin its first cycle at Pro Mujer, part of the Centro Focal de Villa Tejada. It is formed by thirteen members and is run by a board of directors, of which Marisabel is the secretary. The businesses of the members of the communal association include selling potatoes and chuño [freeze-dried potatoes], selling fruit smoothies, selling groceries, a contractor, selling shoes, a merchant, selling clothing, hardware, selling chicken sandwiches, selling salteñas [empanadas], grocery sales and sales of chicken.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small business owners, of which Marisabel is a member. She states that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago, joining by invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently she has a business selling chicken; she says that she learned this business from her last job, where she worked as an employee in sales.
 
The loan that she is currently taking out is for her sales business, to buy chickens wholesale. She will acquire the chickens from the wholesale stores in the city of El Alto and will subsequently sell them in her business. This form of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her home as well as possible, as she is in a civil union and has two children.  

When you ask her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the payment meetings because she likes the people.

loans.use: to buy chicken wholesale

loans.name: Rosario Corapata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSARIO DE CORAPATA”  Iniciarán el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Copacabana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Amalia es el Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de queso y leche y sastre.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Amalia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de leche; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, ya que es un negocio familiar y ella decide seguir el mismo negocio por cuenta propia.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cebada) que adquirirá de las ferias comunales cercanas a su domicilio y posteriormente alimentará a sus animales con este producto para poder comercializar la leche. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta que el préstamo favorezca a las mujeres.
texts.en:
The communal association "ROSARIO DE CORAPATA" is going to start its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Copacabana. It has eight members and is led by a management team where Amalia is the president. The businesses that the members run are varied: sale of cheese and milk, and dressmaking. 

The loan will benefit small microentrepreneurs, Amalia among them. This is the first time she is part of Pro Mujer, after being invited by a colleague who is a member of the institution. She currently has a business where she sells milk. This is her family business and she decided to continue independently.

She will use the loan to invest in capital (buy barley) in communal fairs close to where she lives. She will then feed her animals to commercialize the milk later on. This allows her to generate enough resources to support her household, as she is married and has five children. 

When she is asked about what she likes in Pro Mujer, she says she likes that the loan benefits women.

loans.use: to buy barley.

loans.name: Buenas Nuevas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “BUENAS NUEVAS”  Iniciarán el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Villa Adela, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Claudia es la Secretaria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de productos ESIKA, venta de cocina, confección de zapatos, arreglo de cocina, venta de electrodomésticos, venta de comida, venta de coca.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Claudia es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un familiar que es socia de la institución.
