Tamara's husband sells the agricultural products in the local market; this is the main source of the family's income. 

To continue running her agribusiness in a sustainable way, Tamara needs a loan of USD 3,000 to purchase fuel for agricultural machinery, fertilizer, and forage for the livestock. The loan will help the family sustain their agribusiness. 

Tamara and her husband highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders, and will be grateful to them for their help in collecting the needed amount of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase fuel for agricultural machinery, fertilizer, and forage for the livestock

loans.name: Ouk

texts.en:
Ouk is 39 years old and married. She is one breadwinner in a family consisting of three children, two of whom still count on her. Her family income also comes from her husband's occupation as a government officer. 

For the sake of her family, she grows rice and weaves silk as the primary source of income. She has been involved in this business for several years, and she earns about US $11 per day. 

This is the second microloan for Ouk with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has completely repaid, enabled her to provide three decent daily meals for her children, and to keep them in school. 

For this cycle, she is seeking an education loan to pay the tuition fee for her son, who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree, majoring in Rural Development. 

She hopes her son can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay the tuition fee for her son

loans.name: Manzanitas De Tilacoca Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MANZANITAS DE TILACOCA”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rosa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ganado vacuno, tejido de chompas, tejido de mantas, venta de estuco, venta de artefactos electrónicos, venta de fruta.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rosa es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de mantas; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de una amiga que le enseño la técnica de tejido, posteriormente decide implementar su propio espacio de comercialización.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las ferias tradicionales de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en las ferias rurales. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones en salud y crédito.

En la foto no se encuentra una de las socias, ya que se fue a cuidar su ganado.
texts.en:
The Manzanitas de Tilacoca communal bank will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer. As part of the Focal Point of Achacachi, it consists of eight members and is run by a board of directors where Señora Rosa is president.  The group members carry out various businesses, among them: selling cattle, knitting sweaters, knitting blankets, selling stucco, selling electronics, and selling fruit.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small microenterprises, one of which is Señora Rosa’s.  She says that this is the first time that she has joined Pro Mujer, signing up due to an invitation from an institutional promoter who went to visit her in her home.  Currently, she has a business knitting and selling blankets.  She says that she learned this work from a friend who taught her knitting techniques.  Later she decided to set up her own retail shop.

The loan that she will take out now is to increase her capital (buy the wool) that she gets at the traditional fairs in the city of El Alto, and that she will later sell, after knitting, in the rural festivals. This type of work allows her to generate income to keep up her home as well as possible, because she is married and has three children.

When she was asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the training in health and financial credit.
One of the group members can’t be found in the picture, because she left to care for her cattle.

loans.use: to buy wool

loans.name: El Manantial Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado El Manantial está en su ciclo 14  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir con ingresos medios, pero sigue esforzándose por luchar y mejorar. Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella hace, y que por medio de eso está ayudando a su familia, dándoles lo que necesitan para el día a día. Pide de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para sus comidas, como ser carne, verduras, y demás. Esta agradecida por esta oportunidad que recibe.
texts.en:
The group called El Manantial is in its 14th loan cycle with the women’s communal bank program, where everyone commits themselves to work and help each other to get ahead.  They make up part of the program to eliminate poverty, where everyone is doing the Elimination Survey [see information below].

One of the members is Señora Maria, who showed Level Two poverty on her survey, which is to say a mid-level income, but she keeps putting forth effort to fight and improve.  She works selling foods that she makes, and through this she is helping her family, giving them what they need day to day.  She is asking for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of supplies to make her foods, such as meat, vegetables, and other items.  She is grateful for this opportunity that she has.

loans.use: to buy supplies for meals, such as meat, vegetables, and others.

loans.name: Semsiyye

texts.en:
Semsiyye is 25 year of age and single. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her parents in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. 

Semsiyye has had her own agricultural business for two years already. She has built a greenhouse on a small piece of land, and she is growing vegetables. Her parents are helping her in this business. When her crops are ready, she goes out and sells them in the different markets located near her home.

In Azerbaijan, there is a daily demand for fruits and vegetables because of traditional meals.

She has applied for  loan of  2,000 AZN to buy mineral fertilizers in order to treat her soil and get a good harvest. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Las Constantinas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS CONSTANTINAS”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sonia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ladrillos, trenzado de mantas, venta de dulces, fotocopias, tejido de chambras, venta de comida, venta de frutas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Sonia es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y venta de chambritas; este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años, aprendiendo la técnica de tejido en un trabajo anterior.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará de las en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The "LAS CONSTANTINAS" communal bank will be starting its second cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Collpani centre. It is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors of which Sonia is the President. The businesses which the members of the communal association run are varied and among them are: selling bricks, macrame blankets, selling sweets, photocopying, knitting baby clothes, selling food, selling fruit.

The loan they will take out will benefit small businesswomen of which Sonia is an example. She says she joined Pro Mujer five months ago after being invited by a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently she runs a business knitting and selling baby clothes. She learnt this trade several years ago, having learnt the knitting skills in a previous job.

The loan she will take out is to increase capital to buy wool which she will buy from the wholesale stores in the city of El Alto and will use to make goods to sell. This kind of work allows her to generate income to maintain her household, since she lives with a partner.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the training in loans and health.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.ru: Мархамат трудолюбивая и добродушная женщина. Она родилась в 1961 года. Она с юных лет работала упорно для того, чтобы зарабатывать деньги и обеспечить семью. Она рано вышла замуж, родила 4 детей и занималась их воспитанием. Она всегда была основной кормилицей семьи, так как ее муж имел маленький доход. Мархамат за последнее 10 лет, работает в кондитерском цехе. Она работает кондитером. Мархамат уже знает все тонкости своего дела. Она умеет печь вкусные торты. Мархамат всегда старается, чтобы ее дети жили в хороших условиях. Мархамат планирует отремонтировать свой дом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Marhamat is a hardworking, warmhearted woman. She was born in 1961. Since she was very young, she has worked hard to earn money for her family. She married early, had 4 children, and has been raising them. She has always been the breadwinner in the family, because her husband has a small salary. She has worked as a baker in a sweets shop for the past ten years. She knows all of the ins and outs of her job. She knows how to bake delicious cakes. She has always tried to provide a decent standard of living for her children. Now she is planning to repair her house. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy building materials, such as cement, lumber, etc. She awaits your kind assistance and is counting in your generosity.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement and lumber for repairing house

loans.name: Okkiz

texts.ru: Оккиз является такой женщиной, которая пережила много трудности в жизни. Она вдова и имеет 2 детей. Ее муж умер рано от болезни. Она вместе с мужем работала в колхозе. После смерти мужа она начала самостоятельный бизнес. Она взяла на аренду 1 га земли и начала выращивать сельхоз культуры. Она в основном выращивает овощи и продает свой богатый урожай на местном рынке. Она этим бизнесом занимается уже более 10 лет. Оккиз имеет большой опыт. Она упорно работает и зимой и летом на поле, поэтому она заболела от тяжелой работы. Она вынуждена продолжить работу, так как она является основной кормилицей семьи. Оккиз должна срочно лечить свою болезнь. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки лекарства для лечения. Она надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Okkiz is someone who has been through a lot in her life. She is a widow and has two children. Her husband died young from an illness. She and her husband both worked on a collective farm. After his death she started an independent business, She rented a hectare of land and began to farm. She mainly grows vegetables and sells her abundant harvest at the local market. She has been operating this business for more than ten years. Okkiz is very experienced; she works hard in the field in both winter and summer. Then she fell ill from working too hard. She needs to keep working, because she is the family’s only breadwinner. She has to treat her illness right away. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 3000 somoni for medicine. She is counting on your generosity.

loans.use: To buy medicine to treat an illness

loans.name: Syprian

texts.en:
Syprian is a 30-year-old single man. He describes himself as industrious. He operates a barber shop where he offers hair cutting services. He describes his family challenge to be water shortage. 

He will use the KES 8,700 loan to buy a 1,000 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future he will expand his business. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a 1,000 litre water tank.

loans.name: Aytan

texts.en:
Aytan is  24 years of age, a single client. She  is an IDP (internally Displaced Person) and lives with her parents   in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. Aytan   moved from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Bilasuvar region with her parents. She couldn’t get higher education and because of that she decided to start her own business. For that she chose farming.

She is growing fruits and vegetables in her own yard. Her brother helps her, too. She wants to expand her business. The amount of produce she sells is not enough to cover the high demand. She would like to grow more fruits and vegetables to increase her turnover as well as improve the living conditions of her partners. For this purpose, she has applied for a 2000 AZN loan to buy farming supplies. This will be her second loan, and Aytan has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

loans.name: Marciana

texts.es: La Sra. Marciana es una persona muy trabajadora, en su anterior crédito de Kiva lo utilizo en la compra de una seca ropas industrial. Hoy ellos implementaron una despensa en la que trabaja la familia, son muy luchadores y emprendedores, y Marciana hoy pide de este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de Azucar, Arros, fideo y otros, para poder surtir su despensa y crecer.
texts.en: Marciana is a very hard-working woman who used her previous loan with Kiva to buy an industrial dryer. She now has a grocery store, where her family works. They are very hard-working and entrepreneurial and Marciana is now requesting this loan to buy sugar, rice and noodles, among others, to stock her store and grow.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice and noodles, among others.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
El señor José tiene 51 años y está Casado con la señora Clementina quien tiene 35, tienen dos hijos que van a la escuela, por quienes ambos se están esforzando para poder darles todo lo que ellos no pudieron tener.
El señor José tiene su propia Olería  en su casa, ayudado por un colaborador y su esposa en la tarea de producción, y de esa forma están pudiendo salir adelante, y don José está ayudando con la crianza de sus hijos.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de arcilla para almacenar, ya que es su principal materia prima para producir sin problemas los ladrillos que vende. Agradece a la fundación paraguaya y kiva por la oportunidad que está recibiendo que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Señor José is 51 years old.  He is married to Señora Clementina, age 35. They have two children who go to school, and for whom both of them are working hard so that they can give the children everything that they [themselves] couldn’t have.

Señor José has his own brick-making operation in his home, helped in the production work by a collaborator and by his wife.  In this way they are able to get ahead, and Don José is helping to raise his children.

He is asking for a loan to buy clay in order to stock up, because he needs the clay to make his bricks without any problems.  This clay is the main raw material for making these bricks which he sells.  He expresses his thanks to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity that he is getting, and that will be a great help to them.

loans.use: to buy clay to make bricks.

loans.name: Daisy1 Group

texts.en:
Daisy is the featured borrower of Daisy1's group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been friends, since they left their home country, the Philippines, to come and work in Lebanon to provide their beloved families with the best living.

Daisy is a 48-year-old married mother of one child. She works as a housekeeper and during the weekends she sells clothes to support her family in a well-managed way. Her acquired loan will be invested in increasing her business merchandise with a new winter collection to respond to her increasing customers' needs. Daisy is the first lady from the right side of the picture with short hair.

As for the other group members,  Sapula is the second from the right wearing sunglasses, Rizza is the lady with the yellow top, and Anthoniette is the first from the left.

loans.use: to expand her business merchandise with a new winter collection

loans.name: Matluba

texts.ru: Матлюба заботливая мать прекрасной дочери, которую зовут Сабрина. Матлюба еще в родительском доме научилась шитью национальных мужских халатов «чапан». Она также шьет и национальные матрасы «курпача». Матлюба берет заказы от местных жителей на пошив «курпача», а национальных халатов она продает на местном рынке. Она этим бизнесом занимается уже более 25 лет. Матлюба и ее муж хотят отремонтировать свой дом. Ее муж строитель. Матлюба вместе с семьёй живет в доме, который имеет плохое состояние. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 4000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина, краски и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Matluba is a caring mother of a beautiful daughter named Sabrina. While she was in the maternity ward, Matluba learned how to sew traditional Tadjik men’s quilted “chapan” coats. She also makes traditional Tadjik “kurpacha” mattresses. Matluba accepts orders from local residents to make the kurpachas, and she sells the coats at the local market. She has been operating this business for more than 25 years. She and her husband, who is a builder, want to repair their house. Matluba and her family lives in a house that is in poor condition. She is asking for a loan in the amount of 4000 somoni to buy building materials, such as cement, lumber, pain, etc. She awaits your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, lumber, and paint for repairing her house

loans.name: Amalia Fe

texts.en:
Amalia is 55 years old and lives in Culo Molave Zamboanga del Sur. She is married and has one child.

Amalia has a shop that sells herbal products such as moringa. She has had this business for seven months. She requested a loan to pay for health supplement moringa products.

Amalia has been a member of PMPC for two months. In the future, Amalia hopes to improves her business and build another shop someday.

loans.use: to pay for health supplement moringa products.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 57 years old and lives in Luzaran, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has one child.
 
Elsa has a pig raising business and earns approximately PHP 1,000 each month doing this work. 

She has requested a loan to  purchase feeds and vitamins.
 
Elsa has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Elsa hopes to have more savings.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is married and has three children. She is 51 years old and lives in Eastern Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental.

Rosa sells a variety of fruits to earn a living and has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this work. 

She has requested a loan for 30,000 to purchase an additional variety of fruits.

Rosa has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Rosa would like to be successful in her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits.

location.town: Plaridel-Eastern Pob., Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 33 years old and lives in Sibula, lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is married with an only child. 

To earn a living, Judith has a business selling bananas. She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. Judith has  requested a loan to purchase more bananas.

Judith has been a member of PMPC for three years.  In the future, Judith hopes to have more savings for her child's education.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Veronico

texts.en:
Veronico is 49 years old and lives in Eastern Poblacion, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. He is married with three children. 

Veronico has a bake shop that sells and delivers a variety of sorts of bread. He has had this business for 15 years. He requested a loan  to purchase additional flour, sugar, milk and other ingredients for bread-making.

Veronico has been a member of PMPC for four years.  In the future, Veronico hopes to have another branch of his bake shop.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, milk and other ingredients for bread-making.

location.town: Plaridel-Eastern Pob., Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occide

loans.name: Ezekiel

texts.en:
Ezekiel is a 35-year-old married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be optimistic. He operates a poultry business where he keeps poultry for sale. He describes his family challenge to be water shortage. 

Ezekiel will use the Kes 8,700 loan to buy a 1000 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a 1000 litre water tank

loans.name: Rustico

texts.en:
Rustico is widowed and has only one child. Rustico is 58-years-old and lives in Agunod, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.
To earn a living, Rustico has a pig raising business. He has had this business for two years. Each month, he earns approximately  2,000 PHP. Rustico has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.
In the future, Rustico hopes to have more savings for his future retirement.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for his pig raising business.

loans.name: Sherlinita

texts.en:
Sherlinita is married with one child. Sherlinita is 53-years-old and lives in Looc Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.
Sherlinita sells peanuts to earn a living and has had this business for twenty years. Each month, she earns 3,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 6,000 PHP to purchase additional peanuts.

Sherlinita has been a member of PMPC for 9 years.  In the future, Sherlinita hopes to have more savings for her future.

loans.use: to purchase additional peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Villa Totorani Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VILLA TOTORANI”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Patacamaya, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Adelia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de queso, artesanía en mantas, producción de queso.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Adelia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que también quiso participar en la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido y  venta de awayos, camas, etc.; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre, ya que ella tenía el mismo rubro de negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las comunidades cercanas a su domicilio y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en al pedido del cliente. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan los ahorros y la capacitación.
texts.en:
The communal association Villa Totorani will begin its first cycle with Pro Mujer, part of the Centro Focal de Patacamaya.  It is made up of nine members and is lead by a board of directors on which Señora Adelia is the President.  The businesses carried out by the communal association's members are varied, among them are: selling cheese, hand-crafting blankets, and cheese production.  

The loan that they are taking out will benefit the small business owners, of which Adelia is a member.  She says this is her first time as a member of Pro Mujer, having joined at the invitation of a friend who also wanted to participate in the institution.  She currently has a textile business and sells "awayo" cloth (a traditional woven textile with many uses), beds, etc.  She says she learned this business from her mother, since she relied on the same line of business.

The loan that she will now take out is to increase her capital by purchasing wool that she will get from the communities near her home and then later use in making the products that she will sell at the request of her customers.  This type of work allows her to generate resources to support her household as much as possible since she is married and has five children. 

When asked if she liked Pro Mujer, Adelia replied that she liked the savings and the education.

loans.use: to buy wool.

loans.name: John Bosco

texts.en:
John Bosco is 41 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the  region of Fortportal in Uganda. He is married and has four children with three of them currently in school. 

For the past five years, John Bosco has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells household items. 

To help expand his business, John Bosco has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stock for the business, and it will help John Bosco to generate greater profits. 

John Bosco hopes that in the future he will be able to open a new business. 

John Bosco is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like John Bosco who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: To buy more stock for the business.

loans.name: One Hope Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “One Hope” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of 500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) for each in the group in order to invest in their respective businesses.
 
Adama is the featured leader of this group. Adama is 30 years old. She is married and has one child who is attending primary school. Adama sells onions, cooking oil, beans, rice, palm-oil (the country’s most popular cooking oil), etc. and has been doing this business for five years now. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy the above mentioned items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy onions, cooking oil, beans, rice, palm-oil, etc.in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Magaly

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Magaly en su confección, porque con su credikiva compró telas, adornos, e insumos, con los que elaboró nuevos diseños, que incrementaron sus ventas. Su negocio ha crecido en clientela y esto ha generado más ingresos familiares. Ella envía sus agradecimientos a los financiadores de Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Actualmente está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento, mediante el cual comprará materias primas, e insumos, para producir en esta época de fin de año, ropa de dama que le han encargado  como vestidos, blusas , bermudas y multiusos; ella comprará telas, hilos, y otros insumos. La microempresaria vende a clientes que ya tiene desde hace mucho tiempo a almacenes de diferentes barrios de la ciudad, como sus principales compradores. su experiencia anterior le indica que con una nueva inversión, una vez mas su calidad de vida se aumentará y esto es justamente el exito de Kiva.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Magaly in her business because, with her past Kiva credit, she bought fabrics, buttons, and supplies, which have helped her develop new designs that have increased sales. 

Magaly's business has grown in clientele and this has generated more family income. She sends her thanks to Kiva lenders for their support. She is currently requesting a new loan with which she will buy raw materials and supplies to produce women's clothing like dresses, blouses, short pants and multi-use clothing during the last few months of the year. She will purchase fabrics, thread, and other inputs. This entrepreneur's biggest clients are well-established stores in various parts of her city.

Magaly's past experience has prompted a new investment that will, once again, improve her quality of life which is precisely the success of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy thread, fabric and other inputs

loans.name: Tercita

texts.en:
Tercita is married with five children. Tercita is 53 years old and lives in Looc Proper, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental.
Tercita sells moron (a sweet rice cake dessert) to earn a living and has had this business for six years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,500.00 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000.00 to purchase sugar, malagkit rice, brown cocoa and other ingredients for moron making..

Tercita has been a member of PMPC for twelve years.  In the future, Tercita would like to succeed in her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, malagkit rice, brown cocoa and other ingredients for moron making.

loans.name: Dulce Anahí

texts.es:
Dulce Anahí es clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Dulce tiene 22 años, vive en unión libre, tiene un hijo de dos años y desde hace dos años se dedica al comercio. Su esposo se dedicaba a la vente de perfumes, lo que la motivó a hacerlo también, aparte de juguetes y peluches que vende actualmente. A parte de su negocio Dulce es cajera en una tienda de telas. 

Entre sus clientes tiene familiares y compañeros de trabajo. Ella vende artículos de temporada, por lo que actualmente ofrece juguetes, peluche y perfumes; esta época del año es buena para ella, porque es temporada de ventas y ofrece sus productos en un mercado cercano.

Este préstamo lo pide para invertir en su negocio, surtiendo mercancía para la temporada que viene. Gracias a su negocio Dulce ha podido lograr una estabilidad económica, mejorar su casa comprando muebles y haciendo crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Dulce Anahí is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is her story:  She is 22 years old, and lives with her partner.  She has a two-year old son and has been in business for the past two years.  Her husband has been selling perfumes and this is what motivated her to do so, too, in addition to the toys and stuffed animals that she is currently selling. Besides her business, Dulce is a cashier in a fabric store.  Her customers include family members and fellow workers. She sells seasonal items, so at this time she is selling toys, stuffed animals and perfumes.  This time of year is good for her because sales are high and she sells her products at a nearby market.

She is asking for this loan to invest in her business to replenish her stock for the coming season.  Thanks to her business, Dulce has been able to achieve financial stability, improve her house by buying some furniture and make her business grow.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the coming busy season.

loans.name: Osias

texts.en:
Osias is married and has five children. Osias is 43 years old and lives in Sibula, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental Philippines.

Osias is a farmer who grows rice to earn a living. He has been doing this for 15  years. 

He has requested a loan to purchase farm inputs like fertilizers and pesticide.

Osias has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Osias hopes to have enough savings for his family's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 55 years old and lives in Sibula, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has six children.
 
To earn a living, Nenita has a business selling a variety of fruits. She earns about PHP 5,000 each month doing this work. 

Nenita has requested a loan to purchase a variety of wholesale fruits.

Nenita has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Nenita would like success in her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional variety of fruits.

loans.name: Mesalina

texts.en:
Mesalina is married and has two adult children. She lives in the town of Baclayon, Bohol, Philippines.

To earn a living, Mesalina operates a store where she sells accessories, mostly for women. She started this business a long time ago as her main source of livelihood.

Mesalina is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks of hair clips, combs, head bands and other items. These are the products that will appeal to her customers, especially teenagers. She will use the additional income she earns to improve her family's living standard and continue expanding her business. Moreover, she wants to save money for future use.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of hair clips, combs, head bands and other items.

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
Kuña Rory está en su ciclo número 4º  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están poniendo su mayor esfuerzo por mejorar su vida. Ellas forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Josefina, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, es decir con ingresos buenos, pero debe seguir trabajando para mantenerlos. Ella tiene un kiosco bien surtido, en el cual empieza su trabajo desde muy tempranas horas, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y entusiasta.
La Sra. Josefina Solicita de este crédito para la compra de  insumos y productos varios  para surtir su negocio, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. Los niños que están en la fotografía sin hijos de nuestros clientes.
texts.en:
Kuña Rory is participating in its fourth season with the women's committee program, where they are striving to improve their lives. They are part of the program to eliminate poverty. 

One of the members is Josefina. In the latest survey she was classified at poverty level 3, that is to say, with a good income, but she must continue to work to maintain it. 

She has a well-stocked kiosk, where she starts her workday very early. She is a very hard-working and enthusiastic individual. 

Josefina is requesting a loan to buy various supplies and products to stock up her business. This will help her implement her business plan and will help increase her income. 

The children who appear in the photo are the members' children.

loans.use: to buy various supplies and products for her business.

loans.name: Mairent

texts.es:
Mairent es una microempresaria clienta de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Mairent es casada y tiene dos hijos. Su esposo y suegro se dedican a fabricar aretes, lo cual ella aprovechó e inicio su negocio que consiste en la venta de todo lo relacionado con bisutería y un poco de perfumería; tiene sus clientes fijos en tianguis, mercados, papelerías y tiendas de regalos.  

A ella la motivó empezar a vender una vez que no tenía para la leche de su hijo de 8 meses, por lo que decidió ir a ofrecer sus productos; el recibimiento fue muy bueno y así lleva 16 años dedicándose a su negocio. 

Este préstamo lo pide para surtirse para la temporada navideña venidera, en la cual sus clientes le realizarán pedidos. Gracias a su negocio Mairent ha logrado hacer mejoras en su casa comprando aparatos electrodomésticos y en general mejorando su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mairent is a micro-entrepreneur client of Kubo Financiero and this is her story:  

Mairent is married and has two children.  Her husband and father-in-law make earrings, and Mairent took advantage of that and started her business selling all kinds of costume jewelry and a little bit of perfume.  She has her regular customers at street fairs, markets, stationery stores and gift shops.  She was motivated to work in sales when there was a time when she didn't have money for milk for her 8 month-old son.  This made her decide to sell her products.  She was very well received, and she has been doing this for 16 years. 

She is asking for this loan so she can replenish her inventory for the coming Christmas season during which time her customers place orders. Thanks to her business, Mairent has been able to make improvements in her house such as the purchase of some appliances and generally improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy merchandise that she needs for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Kimoun

texts.en:
Kimoun is 51 years old and a widow.  She is a resident of the Samrong district of Takeo province, She has five children, four of whom still rely on her as two of are in school and the other two are too young for schooling. 

Her family’s main sources of income are rice farming, pig-raising, and the rice-trading business. She has been involved in her current business for 20 years. 

Kimoun is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She takes this loan to support her son by covering his education costs.  He wants to continue for the bachelor's degree in Electronics Engineering. 

She hopes that this financial support will help her son reach his education goal so he can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To cover her son's education costs

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a 27-year-old married woman with 2 children. She lives in Bato, Plaridel Misamis Occidental.
Irene has had a business for 2 years to sell a variety of snacks to earn a living. She has requested a loan to purchase flour, sugar, milk and other ingredients.
Irene has been a member of PMPC for 4  years. In the future, Irene hopes to acquire land of her own.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, milk and other ingredients.

loans.name: Adelia Mary

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Por EL Progreso.
En este lugar vive la señora Adelia, tiene 46 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos  dos de ellos ya mayores de edad, la menor tiene 12 años y   estudian en colegio. Su esposo es taxista.
Doña Adelia es una mujer que le gusta ganarse sus propio ingresos y con esto ayudarle a su hija en los gastos que generan sus estudios, ella tiene un corral en su casa en el cual se dedica a la cría de chanchos, allí también cría gallinas criollas pero sueltas, ya son varios años que se dedica a esta actividad  que le deja buenos ingresos y es un trabajo que no le quita mucho tiempo. 
Este crédito es para comprar alimentos y medicinas para los chanchos y las gallinas. Lleva más de 3 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de mucha ayuda para ella. Sus sueños son que su hija termine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Every 15 days the members of Banco Comunal Mujeres por el Progreso (Women for Progress Communal Bank) meet in Los Bajos de Monecristi, a city known for a variety of typical products familiar within and outside of the country, such as straw sombreros and shawls. Adelia lives here.  She is 46 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are grown.  The youngest is 12 and goes to school. Her husband is a taxi driver.

Adelia is a woman who likes to earn her own income and use it to help her daughter with her school expenses. She has a pen at her house which she uses to raise pigs.  She also raises chickens but they run free. She has been doing this for several years and it provides a good income and doesn't take  too much time.

This loan is to buy feed and medicines for the pigs and chickens. She has been with the Banco Comunal for more than three years and she likes it because the loans are very helpful to her.  Her dream is for her daughter to finish her studies.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for her pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is 44 years old and lives in Divisoria, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 1 child. 
Angelita has a pig raising business and earns approximately 3,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase animal feed and vitamins.
Angelita has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Angelita hopes to save more for her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase animal feed  and  vitamins.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina, who is 49 years old, is happy tending her little store.  She is married with six kids, and her husband is a butcher. 

The store is her means of earning a living in support to her family. Fortunately, her store is located in a populous neighborhood, so she makes promising daily sales. 

Rosalina keeps on running the store well even though there is increased competition from other stores. Rosalina believes that with PMPC's support, as one family they will sustain and beat the competition.  

Rosalina has reached her second year as a member of Paglaum MPC.  She has applied for a loan of PHP 14,000 for the store. Expanding her inventory will mean additional income. 

She has confidence that she can remain a member in good standing. She is a hard-working mother and wishes to sustain her store and from there as  good an education as she can afford for her children.

loans.use: to buy products, such as canned goods, noodles, and other inventory items

loans.name: Yom

texts.en:
Yom is 38 years old and a mother of four dependent children.  She is a local farmer originally from Kampong Cham province.

To support her family, she grows rice on one hectare and raise pigs as the main source of income.  After 13 years' engagement in her current business, she now can earn about USD 6 per day. 

Though never before with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she has applied for an education loan to pay school fees for her son. She hopes that her son can get a good job in the Information Technology industry after graduation.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her son

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Srey Santhor District

loans.name: Apolinary

texts.en:
Apolinary is 33 years old and married.  He has three children with ages ranging from 6 years to 10 years. He describes himself to be disciplined. 

He constructs houses to earn a living. He describes his family's challenge to be a water shortage. He will use the KES 8,700 loan to buy a 1,000 litre tank to store clean water for domestic use. 

He hopes that in the future, he will have more clean-water storage facilities. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a 1,000 litre tank to store clean water

loans.name: Emmanuel Group

texts.es: El grupo lo forman cuatro mujeres de negocio una de ellas es Heisell tiene la edad de 25 años, casada, con dos hijos bajo su cargo, su actividad económica es la elaboración de ropa típica desde hace 5 años, sus productos los comercializa por encargo en el  mercado municipal y mercado de artesanía de Masaya, tiene dos años de ser cliente de la institución. El crédito lo está solicitando para la compra  de rollos de tela, lona, hilos, encajes, cintas de mantequilla, etc. Marling tiene la edad de 20 años su negocio es la compra y venta de cosechas de tamarindo, Carmen tiene 21 años su negocio es la compra y venta de cosechas y Antonia mujer de 52 años de edad su negocio es la venta de sandía y melones.
texts.en:
This group consists of four businesswomen. One of them is Heisell. She is 25 years old, married, and has two dependent children. Her business involves making traditional clothing and it has been in existence for five years. Her products are sold at the municipal market and at the craft market in Masaya. She has been a client of ADIM for two years. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy rolls of fabric, canvas, thread, lace, satin ribbon, and other materials.

Marling is 20 years old and is in the business of buying and selling harvested tamarind. Carmen is 21 years old and is in the business of buying selling harvested crops. Antonia is a 52-year-old woman who has a business of selling watermelons and melons.

loans.use: to buy rolls of fabric, canvas, thread, lace, satin ribbon, and other materials.

loans.name: Consuelo Piedad

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Por EL Progreso.
En este lugar vive la señora consuelo, tiene 44 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos  dos de ellos ya mayores de edad, y una bebita  de 3 años la cual vive con ella y es su adoración. Ella hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad.
Doña Consuelo tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa, pero ella para generara mejores ingresos que le permitan salir adelante también se dedica a  la venta de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas), para la venta de estos productos ella sale a recorrer y también vende en su  casa donde tiene su taller y allí cuando sus clientes llegan a que les cosa alguna prenda también les vende sus productos. Tiene más de 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual saca adelante a su pequeña hija.
Este crédito es para comprar hilos, cierres y productos Yanbal. Lleva dos ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su pequeña.
texts.en: In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a town renowned for its great variety of local products, such as straw hats made from toquilla palm leaves, famous throughout the country and even abroad, the members of communal bank Mujeres Por El Progreso (meaning 'women for progress') meet every other week. Consuelo, who is 44, lives in this town. She is separated and has three children, two of whom are already adults. The third one, a baby girl of 3 whom she adores, lives with her. Some years ago, Consuelo learned sewing in a school in her town. She now has a small workshop at her house, but, in order to increase her income with a view to improving her lot in life, she also sells Yanbal products. Yanbal is a brand of beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and accessories for women. Consuelo sells these products both door-to-door and in her workshop. When customers come to her for sewing services, she can also sell her products. She has been engaged in this activity for over ten years, and this source of income enables her to take care of her small daughter. She asks for the loan to buy thread, zippers, and Yanbal products. She is in her second cycle of loans with the communal bank and she likes the system because getting the loans is a fast process. Her dream is to give her daughter the best possible life.

loans.use: to buy thread, zippers, and Yanbal products.

loans.name: Rossana Maribel

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Por El Progreso.
En este lugar vive la señora Rossana, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 9 años de edad que estudia en escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.
Doña Rossana además de ser una muy buena madre y esposa estudia Ing. Civil en una universidad de Manta, ella para poder solventar los gastos que generan sus estudios decidió dedicarse a la venta de zapatos y sandalias, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta por su localidad y también les vende a sus compañeras de clase. Ella deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días, lleva 4 años en su negocio y  gracias a esto ella puede estudiar y seguir su carrera.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que es así que ella sale adelante con su negocio y sus estudios las ganancias que ella obtiene con su trabajo utiliza para sus gastos de estudios. Este crédito es para comprar zapatos y sandalias. Lleva 5  años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son terminar sus estudios y ser una gran profesional.
texts.en: In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a town renowned for its great variety of local products, such as straw hats made from toquilla palm leaves, famous throughout the country and even abroad, the members of communal bank Mujeres Por El Progreso (meaning 'women for progress') meet every other week. Rossana, who is 29, lives in this town. She is married and has one child, aged nine, who goes to school. Consuelo's husband works in a factory in Manta. In addition to being a very good mother and wife, Rossana also studies civil engineering at a university in Manta. In order to cover the cost of her studies, she decided to set up a business selling shoes and sandals door to door in her town. She also sells to her fellow students at university. She leaves her products on credit and collects payment every two weeks. She has been running her business for four years, and it has enabled her to continue her studies. Rossana is asking for a new loan, since it is indispensable to her business and to her studies, seeing as she uses the income she derives from her business to pay for her education. She will use this loan to buy shoes and sandals. She has been a member of her community bank for five years and likes it because she used her first loan to start her business. Rossana's dreams are to complete her studies and become a successful professional.

loans.use: to buy shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 60 years old and has a partner and children.  She is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Her partner is a farmer. She together with her partner manages their household while operating her business. She works hard to provide for their everyday needs.

Julieta maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products through the popular direct selling brands such as Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and others. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalog, and these are the profits that dealers are earning as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, Julieta is requesting a loan for 19,000 PHP, which she will use to buy additional supplies and merchandise products such as shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments. and other products needed in her business.

Julieta hopes to have more customers and dreams to earn a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and merchandise products such as clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Eav

texts.en:
Eav is the mother of two children and in her early 40s.  She is a local farmer who grows rice and raise pigs. Her residential area is Kampong Cham province.  

She has been involved in her current business for ages, and she can earn about USD 6 per day. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is a six-time borrower including this loan. 

With this loan, she manages to support her lifestyle in a good pace and to keep her kids in school. She will spend the entire loan portion to cover the school fee for her daughter, who wants to study accounting. 

She highly believes that her daughter will get a good job as an accountant and earn a decent income for the family.

loans.use: To pay her daughter's school fee

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose Luis vive en la zona Satélite de la ciudad de El Alto. Está casado ya tiene tres hijos; toda la familia vive juntos en la casa de unjo de sus familiares, ocupando un pequeño departamento de cuatro dormitorios, cocina, baño y comedor.
José Luis solo estudió hasta el nivel primario. Se dedica al transporte de pasajeros usando un automóvil que compró hace muy poco. El préstamo que solicita lo utilizará en la regularización de la compra del automóvil y en el mantenimiento del mismo, pues es su única fuente de ingresos.
José Luis tiene un historial de pagos impecable con IMPRO. Esta es la primera vez que su crédito será canalizado a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
José Luis lives in the District of Satélite in the city of El Alto. He is married and has three children. His entire family lives at the house of one of his relatives. They live in a small area that consists of four bedrooms, a kitchen, a bathroom, and a dining room.

José Luis only completed school through the elementary level. He provides transportation services using an automobile that he bought with a very small amount of money. The loan he is requesting will be used to pay the registration fee for his automobile as well as for vehicle maintenance. This is his only source of income.

José Luis has an impeccable payment record with IMPRO. However, this is the first time that his loan will be funded through Kiva.

loans.use: to pay his automobile registration and for vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Gloria Esmeralda

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Por EL Progreso.
En este lugar vive la señora Gloria, tiene 57 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos,  tres de ellos ya mayores de edad, la menor tiene 16 años y   estudian en colegio y es la única que vive con ellos. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Gloria con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda, ella deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Este negocio lo empezó con el primer crédito que recibió del banco comunal hace más de 10 años el cual le ha ayudado a salir adelante junto a su familia.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar pantalones, camisas y otras prendas que ella vende. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 10 años y le gusta porque así empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son que su hija sea una profesional algún día.
texts.en: In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a town renowned for its great variety of local products, such as straw hats made from toquilla palm leaves, famous throughout the country and even abroad, the members of communal bank Mujeres Por El Progreso (meaning 'women for progress') meet every other week. Gloria, who is 57, lives in this town. She is married and has four children, three of whom are already adults. The fourth one, a girl of 16, goes to school and is the only one who lives with her parents. Gloria's husband is a driver. Gloria, in order to earn money of her own in order to help her husband with household expenses, sells all kinds of clothes. She sells door-to-door, as well as at her house, where customers know to come when they need clothes. She leaves her products on credit and collects payment every two weeks. She started this business ten years ago thanks to her first loan from the communal bank. It helped her improve her lot in life, as well as her family's standard of living. She will use this loan to buy trousers, shirts, and other clothes to sell. She has been a member of her communal bank for ten years and likes it because she used her first loan to start her business. Gloria's dreams are for her daughter to become a successful professional some day.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ana Monserrate

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Por EL Progreso.
En este lugar 	vive la señora Ana, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad y aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es empleado privado.
Doña Ana con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto poder salir adelante y ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo,  zapatos y bisuterías, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su  casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan de alguna prenda o cuando lleva mercadería nueva, ella sale a recorrer tres días por semana, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a  Guayaquil cada vez que necesita. Tiene seis años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos y bisutería. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace  más de 11 años y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan los créditos para salir adelante. Sus sueños son tener un gran local.
texts.en: In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a town renowned for its great variety of local products, such as straw hats made from toquilla palm leaves, famous throughout the country and even abroad, the members of communal bank Mujeres Por El Progreso (meaning 'women for progress') meet every other week. Ana, who is 45, lives in this town. She is married and has four children, all of whom are already adults and still live in her house. Ana's husband is an employee of a private company. Ana, in order to earn money of her own in order to improve her lot in life and help her husband with household expenses, sells all kinds of clothes, shoes, and jewelry. She sells door-to-door, as well as at her house, where customers know to come when they need her wares, or when they know that she has new items on sale. She sells door-to-door three days a week, leaves her products on credit and collects payment every two weeks. She goes to Guayaquil when needed to buy her merchandise. She started this business six years ago, and everything is going well. She will use this loan to buy clothes, shoes, and jewelry to sell. She has been a member of her communal bank for over eleven years and likes it because the loans always helped her improve her lot in life. Ana's dream is to own a big shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes, shoes, and jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Amira Monserrate

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Por EL Progreso.
 En este lugar vive la señora Amira, tiene 26 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos de 9, 8, 6  años de edad y el menor de 7 meses de nacido, los  tres mayores  estudian en  escuela. Su esposo es Ingeniero Civil.
Doña Amira como buena esposa que es realiza el crédito para que su esposo lo utilice para su trabajo, el construye de viviendas y necesita para comprar ciertas herramientas y gastos que tiene en su trabajo, ella siempre lo acompaña a sus trabajo y le ayuda a controlara el personal que labora con ellos, son más de 6 personas que trabajan con ellos a quienes les pagan semanalmente por su trabajo, con esto ellos salen adelante y también estas familias dependen de su labor.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar herramientas y para pagos del personal. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 2 años y le gusta porque los créditos son a muy bajos intereses. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en: In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a town renowned for its great variety of local products, such as straw hats made from toquilla palm leaves, famous throughout the country and even abroad, the members of communal bank Mujeres Por El Progreso (meaning 'women for progress') meet every other week. Amira, who is 26, lives in this town. She is married and has four children. The first three are 9, 8, and 6 years old, and go to school. The fourth one is barely seven months old. Amira's husband is a civil engineer. Amira, good wife that she is, asks for a loan in order to help her husband with his work. He builds houses, and needs the money to buy certain tools and to cover expenses. She works with him and helps him manage their employees, who are more than six and get paid every week. Their families depend on the work they do for Amira's husband. The loan will be used to buy tools and pay employees. Amira has been a member of her communal bank for two years and likes it because the loans are low-interest. Her dream is to give her children the best possible life.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay employees.

loans.name: Estela Mariel

texts.es: Estela de 33 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos de 16 y 10 años de edad. Estela se caracteriza por ser una mujer emprendedora y responsable. Desde hace mucho tiempo logró establecer una pequeña tienda en su lugar de residencia, dicho negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos y junto a su esposo mantiene  la economía de su hogar. Desde hace unos meses ha notado que el techo de su casa necesita que se cambie lo antes posible ya que cuando llueve el agua se filtra y daña sus pocas pertenencias. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera  para reparar el techo de su vivienda ya que no cuenta con el capital para el desembolso pero con lo que percibe de su tienda confía tener la capacidad para pagar las cuotas que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
Estela, 33, lives in a house which she owns with her husband and their two children, 16 and 10. Estela is characterized as an enterprising and responsible woman. A long time ago she achieved establishing a small store in her place of residence. Said business is her main source of income and along with her husband she maintains the economy of her home.

Two months ago, she noticed that the roof of her house needed to be changed as soon as possible given that when it rains the water enters and damages her few belongings. She is applying for this loan from FUSAI to invest it in the purchase of galvanized aluminum and wood to repair the roof of her home. She doesn't have the capital for the expenditure but she perceives that with what she earns from her store she is confident she will have the ability to pay the installments that the loan requires.

loans.use: to buy galvanized aluminum and wood to repair the roof of her home and give better security to the family.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is a married woman from the town of Baclayon, Bohol. Her husband is a fisherman. Estela sells her husband's catch at the market. Estela needs to support her 11 children out of her income. 

Estela is asking for a loan to pay for the repair of the fishing boat.

Her income from fish vending will support her childrens' needs, like food and paying for their education. Estela dreams of making their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to pay for the repair of the fishing boat.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a very hard-working young woman who wishes to get ahead through her own efforts and wants her working life to be more successful. She has a business offering M-pesa services (mobile money transfer), which she has been doing for one year. She also operates a phone accessories business. Both businesses are doing very well.

Janet needs to offer her customers better services and is requesting a loan from Yehu, which she will use to invest in the addition of floats (electronic credits to sell) in her M-pesa business.

loans.use: to invest in the addition of floats (electronic credits to sell) in her M-pesa business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 29-year-old married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be optimistic. He operates a motorcycle-transport business in which he transports customers using his motorcycle. He describes his family challenge to be water shortage. 

He will use the 8,700 KES [Kenyan shillings] loan to buy a 1,000-liter water tank to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future, he will operate a transport agency. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a 1000-liter water tank

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
This is Virginia. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to add more stock in her business.  

She would like to apply for a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase vegetables and fruits for resale. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards.

She is requesting a loan of ksh.50,000 to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos, and hair conditioners.

Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos, and hair conditioners

loans.name: Azaliia

texts.en:
Azaliia is a first-year student at the American University of Central Asia, department of International and Business Law. Here is her story. 

“Two years ago I read statement about American University in the newspaper. I was interested in it. Then I got information about AUCA in the internet and from some friends. It became my favorite university. I learned English from my childhood. Here at AUCA I will exactly get a needed knowledge for achieving my goals. I can confidently say that AUCA is a prestigious university.

I have friends who are AUCA graduates and now they are successful professionals. It’s a very bright example for me. I like all the opportunities and conditions that AUCA offers to all its students. I enrolled the department of International and Business Law, because I want to run a business in future, which will have a legal background and expand it to partnerships abroad. Kyrgyzstan is being developed by business and I would like to endow for economics of my country. 

Also in AUCA I hope I find good friends and we will help each other. This university is a ticket to the world of knowledge, big opportunities, and prospective future. There is a possibility to study or work abroad, which also inspires the students. Amongst all the opportunities that AUCA gives to its students, there is also financial aid provided to all its students. I am also applying for financial aid/Kiva loan, which gives me an opportunity to cover my tuition fees.”

loans.use: to pay for higher education.

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en: Thorn is 43 years old and a father of two dependent kids. For the sake of his children, he does cassava and rice farming as the primary source of income with the support from his wife. This business has returned him about 28,000 KHR [Cambodian riels] per day. This is the first loan for Thorn with Vision Fund (Kiva’s partner). He is now seeking a loan in order to pay for weeding fees for his crop. He hopes that he can gain a good yield from his crop and get more income.

loans.use: To pay for weeding fees for his crop.

loans.name: Yung's Group

texts.en:
Yung is 45 years old and married; she is blessed with five children. To strive for a living, she does rice farming and cassava as the main source of income. She can earn about 28,300 KHR from the business that she has had for 25 years. 

This is the second microloan for Yung with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She repaid her past loan wisely, and it has uplifted her living better than before. 

Now, in a group of two, she is the leader. For this cycle, she is seeking 200,000 KHR whilst her co-borrower is applying for 300,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop. 

She hopes that she can gain a good income to uplift her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her crop

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Thai

texts.en:
Thai is in her mid 40s and has children.  She resides in Kandal province where she grows paddy rice as the main source of income. She earns additional income tailoring wedding dresses. 

Thai wants to pay more attention to her daughter’s education at the tertiary level. She is requesting her first loan, which she will use to cover the tuition fees for her daughter who want to study history. She hopes that her daughter can get a job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees

loans.name: Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “HORMIGUITAS”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Maria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: comerciante de chuño, venta de tunta, comerciante de ganado vacuno, tejido de mantas, artesana de fajas, taller de guantes, venta de carne seca.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Maria es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ganado; cuenta que este negocio lo aprendió de sus padres, ya que ellos tenían el mismo rubro de negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de ganado vacuno) que adquirirá de las comunidades cercanas a su domicilio y posteriormente a la crianza lo comercializará en las ferias rurales. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las reuniones de pago.
texts.en:
The communal bank “HORMIGUITAS” is beginning its third loan cycle with the field partner through the field partner’s Achacachi regional office. This group is made up of ten members and is led by a board of directors, of which Maria is the president. The businesses of the members are varied and include selling chuño and tunta [types of freeze-dried potatoes produced in the Andes], selling cattle, selling dried beef, weaving blankets, crafting woven belts and sashes and designing gloves. 

The loan will be used in some small businesses of which Maria is a member. Maria says that this is the first time she has joined the field partner, and that she joined at the invitation of a representative of the field partner that came to visit her in her home. Maria currently has a business selling cows. She says that she learned this business from her parents, who had the same kind of business. 

Maria will use this loan to increase the capital of her business by buying more cows. She will buy the cows in communities that are near her home. After she has raised the cows she will sell them in rural markets. Maria says that her business allows her to earn income to pay for as many of her household expenses as possible. Maria is in a common-law marriage and has three children.

Asked what she likes about the field partner, Maria says that she likes the payment meetings they have.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 27 years old and lives in Kacwamba in the  region of fortportal in Uganda. For the past two years, he has been working hard to manage his grocery business, selling home use items. 

To help expand his business, Stephen is requesting a loan from BRAC Uganda for 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings, which he will use to expand the business by buying more stock. This loan will help Stephen to generate greater profits and Increase capital. He hopes that in the future he will be able to become a great enterprenuer. 

Stephen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Stephen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more stock

loans.name: Aydin

texts.en:
Aydin is 37 years of age and married. He is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is a farmer and has been raising seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 12 years. During these years, Aydin gained enough skills and experience to run the business. He chose this crop business because it is profitable and because fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them to be healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table of Azerbaijan families and also make a fresh punch. He usually sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 140 AZN.

As his products are in high demand, Aydin wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to meet market demand. For this purpose he applied for 2,000 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Xalil

texts.en:
Xalil is 43 years of age and married. Xalil is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He is raising 3 daughters with his wife. His wife stays at home, so he is the only one making an income for the family. For 10 years, he has grown fruits and vegetables in his yard and sold them in the bazaar. In this business, his wife also helps him, and from this business, his monthly profit is 100 AZN.

In Azerbaijan, fruit is in very high demand because people like to eat fresh fruit a lot. Besides his fruit, he also sells flowers. Xalil is really optimistic about the future, regarding the expansion of his business in order to raise the standard of living of his family. For this, he has applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN. He  has taken a loan from Aqroinvest before. He is considered a good customer and this is his 2nd loan.

loans.use: to raise the standard of living of his family by expanding his business.

loans.name: Amalya

texts.en:
Amalya is 32 years of age. She moved from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Bilasuvar region with her family. Amalya is married and the mother of  2 children. She is a very successful entrepreneur who sells chicken, which brings her a stable income. Amalya is a very hardworking woman. For the past   6 years, she has been raising chickens and is very active in poultry. She usually buys small chickens, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then sells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her husband also helps her in this business because it is the only income for their family. From this business, her monthly income is 120 AZN.

In Azerbaijan chicken is in very high demand because people use it in everyday dishes like levengi, chicken soup, tabaca, kabab, etc. Amalya sells chicken eggs too. People eat chicken eggs every day for breakfast. In one day, she sells approximately 50 eggs.

Amalya has now applied for her first loan. With this money, she wants to invest in her business and buy more small chickens in order to generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy more small chickens.

loans.name: Seyhun

texts.en:
Seyhun, a 33-year-old married father of two, is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) living in an IDP Settlement. A mechanical engineer who does car engineering and car repairs, he has six years of experience in the service field, earning a monthly income of 180 AZN. His wife is a teacher in the local school, while Seyhun's father helps him because he is also an engineer. 

Seyhun is requesting his second loan for 1900 AZN to purchase modern car repair tools in order to improve the quality of service he provides to customers. He has a good client history and has never been delinquent in making his repayments.

loans.use: to purchase modern car repair tools

loans.name: Karen Elizabeth

texts.es: Karen de 18 años de edad es una joven emprendedora y muy trabajadora. Habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de 4 años. Desde muy joven comenzó a trabajar para colaborar con la economía de su hogar puesto que con lo que gana su compañero de vida no alcanzan a cubrir los gastos del hogar. Karen se dedica a la venta de ropa de manera ambulante en las diferentes zonas de su localidad. Para ella lo más importante es su familia y es por ella que trabaja duramente para sacar adelante a su familia. Desea mejorar las condiciones de la cocina la cual está construida a base de lámina y con el tiempo, el sol y las lluvias se ha deteriorado por lo que es necesario invertir en el cambio de la misma. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera para reparar su cocina.
texts.en: Karen, 18, is an enterprising and very hardworking young woman.  She lives in her own house with her life partner and her little 4-year-old son.  She started working when she was very young to contribute to her household income since her partner doesn't earn enough to cover their household expenses.  Karen works as a mobile vendor selling clothing in different areas of her community.  Her family is the most important thing to her, and she works hard to help her family get ahead.  She wants to make improvements to her kitchen, which is constructed of sheet metal.  It has become worn out over time and from the sun and rain so she needs to invest in fixing it.  She requests this loan from FUSAI to spend on galvanized sheet metal and wood to repair her kitchen.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal and wood to repair her kitchen

loans.name: Orlando De Jesus

texts.es:
