El señor Orlando de Jesus es un pequeño agriculto que vive en la zona rural de a unos 4 Km al norte de la Ciudad de Condega, en el Departamento de Esteli, Este Señor tiene unos 14 años de redir en esa comunidad junto a su esposa y su hija una pequeña en edad escolar.

El Señor Orlando de Jesus se dedica desde hace unos 25 años aproximadamente a la crianza de ganado bovino asi como a la produccion de granos basicos tales como es el maiz y el frijol, cabe mencionar que a este cliente se le ha ortogado financiamiento para el manejos de estos rubros en 7 ciclos, ahora el se presenta para hacer una nueva solicitud de credito para la compra de una vaquilla y asi de esta manera ir aunmentando su hato ganadero ya que esta es una de sus principales fuentes de ingresos.

En ocasiones nateriores el a logrado mejorar y desarrollar su unidad productiva a traves de los financiamiento que le a otorgado ceprodel por lo que se muestra agradecido ya que sus logros ha sido positivos, por lo que espera tener una respuesta positiva del credito que solcita nuevamente.
texts.en:
Orlando de Jesus is a small farmer who lives in a rural zone about 4 Km to the north of the city of Condega, in the Esteli department. This man has been in this community for 14 years along with his wife and his daughter, a small school-age child.

Orlando de Jesus has been making his living raising cattle for approximately 25 years, as well as the production of basic grains like corn and beans. It's worth mentioning that this borrower has been granted financing for the handling of this business in 7 cycles. Now he comes forth to make a new loan request for the purchase of a heifer. By doing so, he will increase his cattle herd given that this is one of his principal sources of income.

En prior occasions, he has achieved improving and developing his productive unit through the financing that has been granted him by Ceprodel. For this, he shows thanks since his accomplishments have been positive. Therefore, he hopes to have a positive response for the new loan he is applying for.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Denis Alexander

texts.es: Denis de 36 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos de 15 años, 10 años y 4 años de edad. Denis se dedica a la venta de verduras desde hace 10 años. De esta forma lleva el sustento a su hogar. Con el deseo de dar mejores condiciones habitacionales a su familia desea construir un pequeño cuarto a base de lámina para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y madera ya que no cuenta con el efectivo para hacerlo por su cuenta pero expresa tener la capacidad del pago que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
Denis is 36 years old. He lives in his own home with his life companion and three children aged 4, 10 and 15 years. Denis has sold vegetables for the last 10 years. He supports his household doing this. 

With the desire to improve the living conditions of his family he wants to construct a small room out of metal sheeting. So he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in buying galvanized sheeting and wood. He does not have the cash to pay for it himself but he expressed the ability to pay off his loan and his past credit supports that claim.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheeting and wood to build a room.

loans.name: Ma. Juna

texts.en:
Ma. Juna is a married woman and the mother to two children. She is from the town of Baclayon, Bohol. She and her husband are engaged in a tricycle transport business. This is the source of their income.
 
Ma. Juna is asking for a loan to buy gasoline and spare parts, like tires, nuts, bolts, and chains, for the tricycle.

Ma. Juna hopes that they will be able to improve their business so that it will generate more income for the needs of the family especially for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy gasoline and spare parts, like tires, nuts, bolts, and chains, for the tricycle.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Florence did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. 

Currently, Florence sells smoked fish in Narkwa (near Elmina). She has been doing so for about 10 years. As a divorcee with five children, Florence uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Florence will use the loan to buy more fish to smoke, which will aid her in improving overall sales. 

Florence wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to buy more fish to smoke, which will aid in improving overall sales.

loans.name: Patsy Beatriz

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Por EL Progreso.
En este lugar vive la señorita Patsy, tiene 25 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que brindan estos créditos para salir adelante.
Doña Patsy es una joven muy trabajadora que le gusta salir adelante a base de su esfuerzo y así forjarse un mejor futuro para ella y para cuando decida formar su familia tener su propio negocio, ella espera con este crédito compra ciertas cosas que necesita para inaugurar su restaurante, pues a ella le encanta cocinar y quiere sacar provecho de algo que le gusta hacer.
Este crédito es para comprar ollas, platos y sillas que aun le hacen falta para empezar con su negocio de venta de comida. Sus sueños son empezar su negocio y que este vaya mejorando día a día.
texts.en: In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a town renowned for its great variety of local products, such as straw hats made from toquilla palm leaves, famous throughout the country and even abroad, the members of communal bank Mujeres Por El Progreso (meaning 'women for progress') meet every other week. Patsy, who is 25, lives in this town. She is single and lives with her parents. This is her third loan cycle with the communal bank, and she likes it because the loans help her get ahead in life. Patsy is very hard-working and very keen in giving her all to improve her life and build a better future for herself. She wants to have her own business by the time she starts her own family. She hopes to use the loan to buy the things she needs to start her restaurant, which is a business she chose because she loves to cook and she wants to earn money doing something she loves. She will use the loan to buy pots, dishes, and chairs, which are items she needs to start her business selling food. Her dreams is to be able to start her own business and to see it grow day after day.

loans.use: to buy pots, dishes, and chairs.

loans.name: María Elizabeth

texts.es:
En Los Bajos de Montecristi, ciudad conocida por su gran diversidad de productos típicos, como por ejemplo los sombreros de paja toquillas conocidos dentro y fuera del país se reúnen cada 15  días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Por EL Progreso.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 8 y 7 años de edad, ambos  estudian en  escuela. Su esposo trabaja ocasionalmente.
Doña María hace tiempo atrás con los pocos recursos que tenia y con ayuda de su primer crédito construyo un pequeño corral en su casa, allí cría pollos durante el tiempo adecuado para que estén listos para el consumo y luego entrega a comerciantes que llegan hasta su casa o vende a vecinos de la zona ya sea en pie o pelados, esto le permite salir adelante cuando su esposo no tiene trabajo.
Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que siempre realiza los créditos para mejorar su negocio, con sus ganancias ella compro mas pollos ya que esta época que se avecina es muy buena y sus ganancias serán mejores las cuales espera utiliza para comprar ropa para sus hijos. Este crédito es para compra pollos, alimentos y medicinas para los pollos. Lleva más de 4 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos sale adelante. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en: In Los Bajos de Montecristi, a town renowned for its great variety of local products, such as straw hats made from toquilla palm leaves, famous throughout the country and even abroad, the members of communal bank Mujeres Por El Progreso (meaning 'women for progress') meet every other week. María, who is 30, lives in this town. She is married and has two children, aged 8 and 7, who both go to school. María's husband works occasionally. A while ago, María used the little resources that she had and with her first loan, she built a small pen in her house and bought chickens, which she raises until they are ready for consumption. She sells them to merchants that come to buy at her house or to neighbours, she either sells by the pound or by unit. This is how her and her family get ahead when her husband doesn’t get work. She is repeating the loan, because it is a valid strategy to improve her business. The profits from the previous season were used to buy more chickens, since the coming season looks promising. She hopes for bigger profits that will enable her to buy clothes for her children.This loan is to buy chickens, feed and medicine. She has been with the community bank for over 4 years and she likes it because she gets ahead with the loans. Her dream is to give her children the best possible life.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed and medicine.

loans.name: Romaldina

texts.es: La señora Romaldina de 41 años de edad, vive con su esposo y tiene 3 hijos que dependen de sus ingresos, es una persona responsable y tiene muchas ganas de superarse, se dedica a la producción de leche cruda, tiene una experiencia de 13 años y cuenta con la  ayuda de sus hijos en el trabajo ya que es una actividad familiar. Su producción bajo por que tres de sus vacas se enfermaron y ahora requiere un crédito de Bs 10200 para comprar una cabeza de ganado vacuno lechero, con el fin de mantener o aumentar el nivel de producción y satisfacer sus necesidades económicas.
texts.en: Romaldina is 41 years old, lives with her husband, and has three dependent children. She is a very responsible person, who always seeks to do her best. She produces raw milk and has over thirteen years' worth of experience in this field. This is a family business, so her children help her. Her production has gone down since three of her cows fell ill, which is why she needs a loan of 10,200 bolivian bolivianos in order to buy a milk cow, with the aim of sustaining or increasing her production and meet her economic needs.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow.

loans.name: Erick

texts.en: Erick is a 26-year-old farmer who hails from the town of Kisii. He has been involved in mixed farming for five years, and his main source of income is from the sale of milk. He enjoys farm work, especially tilling the land in preparation for planting, but doesn't like when weeds grow in between his crops. Erick said that he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer good services to their clients. He knows that microfinance institutions offer their loans at a low interest rates, and that this loan will benefit his family in that it will ensure there is always good water circulation to his farm for producing good crops and bringing in more income.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en: Aged 54 and a villager from Kampong Cham province, Soeun is married and blessed with six children. The main sources of her family’s income are from rice farming on two hectares of farmland and from the paid-working job at a construction site. These businesses have returned her about 32,800 KHR per day. She has not applied for a loan through VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. She now applies for a loan to support her existing business for purchasing potash for her crop. She hopes that this purchase will double her crop yield and gain a good income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan vive en casa de unos familiares en un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento en la zona de Rosas Pampa de la ciudad de El alto. El oficio que desempeña es transportista, pues tiene una movilidad con la cual genera sus ingresos. Juan  necesita el crédito para el mantenimiento de su herramienta de trabajo (cambio de aceites, líquidos y chequeo de frenos) para un perfecto funcionamiento y así poder obtener mayores beneficios y poder cubrir con los gastos que tiene en su hogar.

El sueño de Juan es poder tener casa propia y que sus hijos terminen su estudio superiores.
texts.en: Juan lives in a house with brick walls and a concrete floor in the neighbourhood of Rosa Pampa of the town of El Alto. He drives a vehicle which he uses to provide transportation services, his only source of income. He needs the loan to perform maintenance on his vehicle, which needs an oil and fluid change, and a brake check. With a vehicle at peak performance, Juan can have better profits and meet household expenses. His dream is to have a house of his own and to see his children finish university.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on the vehicle he uses to provide transportation services.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La Sra. Lourdes es una mujer muy empeñosa; vive con su señora madre en la zona de tembladerani  ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.  La actividad de la Sra. Lourdes es empleada de una empresa encargada del cuidado de la ornamentación pública de la ciudad. Ella tambien tiene la actividad de dar a credito viveres por fin de año armando asi los canastones navideños a credito pues el año pasaddo le fue muy bien. La cliente es separada. Y vive actualmente con sus dos pequeños hijos. La Sra. Lourdes necesita el credito para hacer la compra de viveres y conservas para asi empezar con la preparación y otorgacion de los canastones y poder tener mayores ingresos mayores  y asi poder hacer frente a los gastos que tiene en su hogar.

El sueño de Lourdes es poder tener mayores ingresos en base al sacrificio que hace su familia, y poder tener una mejor calidad de vida para sus hijos, asi para poder formarlos academica como profesionalmente.
texts.en: Lourdes is full of enterprising spirit. She lives with her mother in the neighbourhood of Tembladerani of the town of La Paz. She works for a company tasked with the maintenance of public monuments and decorations in the city. She also has her own business, which consists in selling (on credit) Christmas food baskets, which were a hit last year. She is separated and lives with her two small children. She needs the loan to buy fresh food and tinned food in order to start making the baskets, and planning to whom she is going to sell them. This way, she will make more money and be able to meet household expenses. Lourdes's dream is to earn a bigger income by sparing no effort, in order to give her children a higher standard of living, and to see them succeed at school and have a career.

loans.use: to buy fresh food and tinned food in order to make Christmas baskets and sell them during the festive season.

loans.name: Marly Clementina

texts.es: Marly como profesión es maestra de educación primaria de un Núcleo Educativo Rural del cual viaja diario a impartir sus clases con 12 años de laborar, convive con su pareja de manera libre con 2 hijos procreados en ese ceno familiar, a los que ambos le brindan las atenciones que se merecen,  esta señora manifestó tener una necesidad de mejorar su vivienda por lo que se presento a las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento y utilizarlo en la compra de cemento, arena, piedrín, ladrillo, hierro, tubos, verjas y mano de obra, para la construcción de un porche y mejorar las condiciones  de su familia.
texts.en:
Marly works as a Primary School teacher in a Rural Education Center. She travels to here every day to give her classes which she has done for the past 12 years. She lives with her common-law partner and two children, fruit of this union. They care for their children, giving them all they need.

Marly states that she needs to improve her house so she came to the offices of Ceprodel to request a loan. She will use it to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, re-bar, tubing, iron grilles and to pay for labor. She will build a porch to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks, re-bar, tubing, iron grilling and pay for labor.

loans.name: Dora Luz

texts.es: Dora se desempeña como maestra de educación primaria de un colegio de la zona donde vive con 21 año de impartir el pan de la enseñanza, vive en unión libre, no tiene hijos a su cargo ya son adultos, esta señora tiene la necesidad de mejorar su vivienda, por tal razón visito las oficinas de ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento y lograr cumplir el sueño deseado, ya que el mismo lo utilizaría en la compra de Cemento, Bloques y Hierro, para la construcción de un cuarto y de esa manera mejorar las condiciones de su familia
texts.en:
Dora works as a Primary School teacher in a school in the area she lives in. She has been teaching for 21 years. She lives in a common-law relationship. She has no dependent children, they are all now adults. 

Dora needs to make improvements to her house, so she visited the Ceprodel Offices to request a loan to fulfill this dream. She will use the loan to buy cement, cider blocks and re-bar to construct a room and improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, cider blocks and re-bar.

loans.name: Al Sadaka Group

texts.en:
Samira is the featured borrower of Al Sadaka group. She has always been neighbors and friends with the other group members.

Samira is a 39-year-old, married mother of three children. She is a hard-working woman who started in 2009 to sell Brazilian gold and beauty cosmetics. She works from her house to manage both her business and family issues. Her husband supported her a lot at the beginning and now she is capable of managing her business and supporting her husband at the same time in covering their family's needs. Samira is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to pay for her children's school fees and to increase her business merchandise with a newly released collection. She hopes to expand her business more and more in the future and stay capable of supporting her family as much as she can. She is the lady at the center of the picture, standing in the middle. 

As for the other group members, Fawziya is the lady with blond hair, and Khadija is the first from the left.

loans.use: to pay her children's school fees and to increase her business merchandise with a newly released collection

loans.name: Asaf

texts.en: Asaf is 33 years old and married, but does not yet have any children. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives in an IDP Settlement with his wife. He has had his own agricultural business for the last six years, and has built a greenhouse on a small piece of land where he grows vegetables. When his crops are ready he goes out and sells them in different markets near his home. This is a good business to be in because in Azerbaijan there is a daily demand for fruits and vegetables for people to use when making traditional meals. He has already taken out one prior loan from Aqroinvest and successfully repaid it. He is requesting a second loan for 2,000 AZN to buy mineral fertilizers in order to improve his soil and get a good harvest.  He appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Parvana

texts.en:
Parvana is 44 years old and married, with three children. She is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) and lives in an IDP Settlement with her family. 

She is a farmer and raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. She has nine years of experience in this field, which makes her an experienced and skilled person. 

Parvana usually sells her crop to market vendors in her area. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table in the Azerbaijan family and also make fresh punch. 

Raising crops takes a lot of strength, in addition to working in the open air. This is very hard work, and that's why her son helps her. Her monthly income is AZN 100.

She needs additional money to invest in seeds and fertilizer. This will allow her to improve the quality of products she raises and increase her monthly turnover. For this purpose, she has applied for AZN 2,000. 

This will be her second  loan, and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to invest in seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Mary is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling provisions in Narkwa (near Elmina). She has been involved in this enterprise for four years. Mary is married and has three children. Her husband works as a fisherman. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Mary wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions. In the long term, Mary plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Although he has received no prior formal education, Richard is an entrepreneur. He specializes in selling salt in Narkwa (near Elmina). 

He has been involved in this enterprise for five years. Richard is married and has three children. His wife works as a trader. The proceeds from his business normally go towards helping his wife cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Richard wants to use his loan to increase his current inventory levels, hence allowing him to sell greater quantities of salt and earn more money.

In the long term, Richard plans to reinvest future profits into his business, thus helping him expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands

loans.use: to buy more salt to sell, increasing his turnover and earnings

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Although she has received no formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling soap in Narkwa (which is near the town of Elmina). She has been involved in this enterprise for three years, and is married and has two children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Efua will use this loan to buy increased amounts of soap to sell, thus improving her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, and thereby adapt to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to improve sales by buying more soap to sell.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Even though Sabina grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. 

Currently, Sabina is an entrepreneur. She sells dried beans and groundnuts in Narkwa (near Elmina). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began it two years ago. 

Sabina is married and has four children. Her husband works as a carpenter. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Sabina wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory, allowing her to sell more dried beans and groundnuts.

In the long term, Sabina plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory, allowing her to sell more dried beans and groundnuts.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 25 year old man. He describes himself to be social. He operates a retail shop where he sells maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, bread and other items. He describes his family challenge to be the lack of clean water. He will use the KES 8,700 loan to buy a 1,000 litre water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a 1,000 litre water tank.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a Liberian. She is 42 and married with 2 children, who are 14 and 29 years old. One child is currently living at home and attending school.  Martha resides in Buchanan, the capital City of Grand Bassa County. The county is located by the sea and is known for its beaches and fish. In addition, many logging companies are also located in the city. People in Buchanan are known in the country for their love of fufu, a cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.
 
Martha owns her own small, local shop, selling fashion slippers for the past two years.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more slippers for her business.  On average, she works eight hours at her business from Monday to Saturday. She started her business with some money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by shared taxi. She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is the money she makes. 

In the future, Martha would like to build a house. She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more slippers for her business.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is the married mother of four children and from the town of Baclayon, Bohol. 

Josefina's husband is a fisherman.  Whatever he catches from a night of fishing, she will sell in the neighborhood in the morning. This is their source of income. 

Josefina is asking for a loan to buy nylon for repairing fishing nets and fishing hooks. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

Josefina hopes to make their business a success so that it will generate more revenue necessary for their needs, especially for the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy nylon for repairing fishing nets and fishing hooks

loans.name: Theay

texts.en: Theay, a local farmer from Kampong Cham province, is 40 years old and blessed with four children. Her main source of income is from rice farming and cassava farming. Occupied in her current business for 20 years, she is able to generate almost 38,500 KHR per day. Theay is a first-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now, she is seeking a loan in order to buy fertilizer and herbicide for her crops. She hopes that she can gain a good yield from her crops and make more income so she can buy rubber tree seedlings for growing as additional income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide for her crops.

loans.name: Edna's Group

texts.en:
Edna is 25 years old and single with one dependent child. To make a living, she has been selling ready-made shirts and dresses. This current business earns her family about GHS 40 per week to save and use for her child's up-bringing. 

Edna’s Group consists of two members and has been with Kiva’s partner, ID-Ghana, for four cycles.  Edna has successfully repaid her previous loans which have helped her to better support her daughter’s education and relieve her family’s financial burden. 

Now she is leading her group to apply for another a loan of GHS 1600 with ID-Ghana. She will use her portion to buy more ready-made shirts and dresses to sell. She hopes that this loan will enable her to keep her child in a good school and increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy more ready-made shirts and dresses to sell.

loans.name: Luisa Del Carmen

texts.es: Luisa es una mujer ejemplar además de impartir clases  como Docente de educación primaria con 15 años de laborar,  es madre soltera con 2 hijos los que le da todo el amor que se merecen siendo madre y padre al mismo tiempo, esta señora visito a ceprodel para solicitar financiamiento para efectuar unas mejoras a su vivienda, el cual lo utilizaría para la compra de Puertas, Ventanas, Cemento, Cerradura, Perlin y Mano de Obra, ya que dichas mejoras le vendría a dar  mayor seguridad y condiciones a su familia.
texts.en:
Luisa is an outstanding woman. Besides giving classes as a Primary School teacher for the past 15 years, she is also the single mother of two children. She gives them all her love as she needs to be mother and father at the same time.

Luisa visited the Ceprodel offices to request a loan to make improvements on her home. She will use the loan to buy windows, doors, cement, a lock, wood and to pay for labor. These improvements will allow for better security and living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy doors, windows cement, a lock, wood and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.en:
Primitiva is married and the mother of two children; she is from Baclayon, Bohol, Philippines. 

She is into the direct selling of Personal Collection and Fuller Life products, such as lotions, colognes, cosmetics, household cleaners, and clothes. Primitiva has been in the business for several years now. She also operates a sari-sari (or variety) store business.

Primitiva is asking for a loan to buy more items like hand and body lotions, body talc, cosmetics, and household cleaners. With this, she will be able to sell more to her customers, thus augmenting her income and profit.

loans.use: to buy more items like hand and body lotions, body talc, cosmetics, and household cleaners

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Martha Lorena,  es madre soltera de 5 hijos de los cuales solo está a su cargo, su negocio es venta de calzado unisex en  uno  de los mercados de la ciudad de león, desde hace once años,  ofertando  sus productos  desde las 6:00 am y finaliza hasta las 4:30 pm de lunes a sábado. 

Este crédito fue utilizado para compra de sandalias bajas y de tacón, zapatos cerrados para ambos sexos.

La señora Martha con los créditos que Ceprodel le ha bridado ha logrado a comprar productos de  mayor calidad para ofertarles a sus clientes y público en general de esta manera aprovechar la temporada navideña que está por iniciar, además le permitirá aumentar su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena is the single mother of five children who are dependent on her. Her business is selling unisex footwear in one of the markets in the city of Leon. She has done this for 11 years offering her product from 6 am until 4:30 pm, Monday to Saturday.

Martha will use this loan to buy both low and high heeled sandals and shoes for both sexes. With the loan that Ceprodel has given her Martha can buy higher quality products to offer her clients and the general public. She can take advantage of the Christmas season which is just starting. Plus the loan will allow her to increase her working capital.

loans.use: to buy sandals and shoes for men and women.

loans.name: Believe God Ii Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you the members of the “Believe God II” group. They are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in the group in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Ibrahim is the featured leader of this group. Ibrahim is 36 years old and married.  He has two children, one of whom is attending primary school and the other is not of school age. A native of Lunsar town, Ibrahim is married to a farmer.

Ibrahim sells mobile phones, flashlights, etc., and has engaged in this business for five years now. 

Ibrahim is going to use his share of this loan to buy mobile phones, phone accessories, flashlights, etc., in larger quantities for resale.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones, phone accessories, flashlights, etc., in larger quantities for sale

loans.name: Tamaraneh Iv Group

texts.en: Gibrilla is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. She was born in northern Sierra Leone 40 years ago, is married to a trader and is the mother of three children, one of whom attends primary school. Her other children are not yet of school-going age. For the last 10 years, Gibrilla has earned a living by sell toiletries. With the help of this loan, Gibrilla and the other members of her group will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more sales and improve their living conditions. She will use her share of the loan (500,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL)) to buy a large quantity of toiletries to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of toiletries to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ana Johelsy

texts.es:
La joven Ana Johelsy es una madre soltera y unico sosten de su familia que vive junto a sus dos hijos en edad escolar primaria en el Municipio de condega  a unos 35 km al Norte de la Ciudad de Estelí.

Estea joven tiene mas de 12 años de laborar como obrera en una fabrica de Puros en este municipio en la elaboracion de Puros de tabaco, ella labora de lunes a viernes desde las 7 am hasta las 5 pm, siendo esta su principal fuente de ingreso para sufragar sus gastos familiares.

Esta joven se presento a las oficinas de Ceprodel con el objetico de solicitar un financiamiento para el pago de unos gastos medico como son examenes ycompra de medicamento ya que ella a tenido problemas de salud en sus vista y necesita realizarce periodicamente examenes para el monitoreo de sus salud.

Esta clienta ya a tenis 15 creditos y se postiva que este nuevo credito que solicita le sera aprobado y asi poder realizarce los exmanes y comprar el medicamento que tanto necesita, ella se a mostrado agradecida por el apoyo que de esta manera Ceprodel le a brindado ya quele a ayudado a mejorar su modo de vida y espera seguir recibiendo ese apoyo.
texts.en:
Ana Johelsy is a single mother and the sole provider for her two children who are elementary school age. They live together in the municipality of Condega, which is 35 kilometers north of the city of Estelí. For more than twelve years, Ana Johelsy has worked making cigars in a factory in this municipality. She works Monday through Friday from 7am until 5pm, and she says that this is her main source of income to meet her family’s expenses.

Ana Johelsy is requesting this loan from the field partner to pay for medical expenses and to buy medications. She says that she has health problems and needs to periodically have tests to monitor her health.

Ana Johelsy has had 15 loans with the field partner, and she thinks that this loan will be approved so that she can buy the medication that she needs very badly. Ana Johelsy is grateful for the help that the field partner has given her to improve her way of life, and she hopes to continue to receive their help.

loans.use: to pay for medical tests and to buy medication.

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.es:
La Señora Yamileth, es enfermera de uno de los centros de salud de la ciudad de León, desde hace veintisiete años. Sale de su casa a las 6:30 am e inicia sus labores desde 07:00 am hasta las 03:00 pm este  horario de lunes a viernes, es madre soltera de tres hijos de los cuales solo uno está a su cargo. Realiza estas labores para el sustento de su familia.
  
La señora Yamileth solicita a Ceprodel un crédito para utilizarlo  para gastos de graduación de su hija, lo que le permitirá optar al título de su carrera.

La señora esta agradecida con Ceprodel por el apoyo que le puedan brindar, su sueño es ver a su hija culminar su carrera y convertirse en un profesional.
texts.en:
Yamileth has been a nurse at one of the health centers in the city of León for 27 years.  She leaves her house at 6:30 a.m. and starts her work at 7:00 a.m. until 3:00 p.m.  This schedule is from Mondays through Fridays.  She is the single mother of three children; only one of them is under her care.  She does this work in order to support her family.

Yamileth is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to pay for her daughter’s graduation expenses.  This will allow her to get her degree.  She is grateful to Ceprodel for the support they are able to provide.  Her dream is to see her daughter complete her degree and become a professional.

loans.use: to pay for graduation expenses.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en: Edson is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, neither of whom currently attends school. For the last four years, Edson has worked hard to manage his grocery, where he sells essential goods. To help expand his business, Edson has requested a loan for 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more items to sell to his customers, generate greater profits and increase his customer base and sales volume. Edson hopes that in the future he will be able to own a big shop. He is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), which primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Edson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but run businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy goods for his store.

loans.name: Marivel

texts.es: Marivel es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora de 52 años de edad, soltera, su negocio es la venta de pollos y embutidos desde hace 6 meses se dedica a esta actividad económica, tiene a un ayudante en particular. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de productos como piernas, chincaca, conito, salsicha, huevo, embutidos, etc.
texts.en:
Marival is a tenacious and hard-working woman.  She is 52 years old and single.  Her business is selling chicken and sausages.  She has been engaged in this business activity for six months.  She has a private person helping her.

She needs the loan to buy products like ham, molasses, hot dogs, eggs, sausages, and others.

loans.use: to buy products like ham, molasses, hot dogs, eggs, sausages, and others.

loans.name: Charisse Ann

texts.en:
Charisse Ann is married and the mother of four young children, living in Baclayon, Bohol, in the Philippines.

Se has operated a candle-making business for more than five years now. This is the source of the family's income.

Charisse Ann is requesting a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy more materials for candle-making, such as wax, candle wicks, and dye .

She hopes to earn greater income in order to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy materials for candle-making, such as wax, candle wicks, and dye

loans.name: Jose Noel

texts.es: El señor Jose Noel se dedica a la actividad de prestar servicios en su taller de mecanica, tiene experiencia de 30 años, su negoico esta ubicado en el barrio de Santa Ana, es padre de cuatro hijos todos en edad escolar por los que se esfuerza para sacarlos adelante, trabaja de lunes a sabado, empezo su negocio con aporte propio ahorro para poner su negocio antes el señor Noel trabajaba en una empresa de nombre picacho en taller de aviaciòn, el señor solicita el financiamiento para comprar respuestos para su negocio ya que aprovecha en repararle al cliente sus vehiculos y ofrecerles el respuestos que ellos necesitan.
texts.en:
Jose Noel works to provide services from his machine shop. He has 30 years of experience and his business is located in the Santa Ana neighborhood.  He is the father of four children, all of school age, and he works hard to provide for them.  He works from Monday to Saturday.  He started his business with his own savings which he earned by first working in a top-name aviation workshop.

Jose Noel is asking for a loan so he can buy spare parts for his business. It is advantageous for him to be able to offer his customers the spare parts they need when he repairs their vehicles.

loans.use: to buy some tools and spare parts for vehicles.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is 26 years old and lives in the town of Kacwamba in the  region of Fortportal in Uganda. She has one child. 

For the past two years, Lillian has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells various drinks. 

To help expand her business, Lillian has requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase her stocks by buying more beers and other drinks, and it will help Lillian to generate greater profits and increase her capital. 

Lillian hopes that in the future she will be able to have an independent business. 

Lillian is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Lillian, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase her stocks of beers and other drinks

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania is a 54-year-old married woman from the town of Sikatuna, Bohol. She owns a tailoring business with the help of her sewing machine. She has requested a loan of 21,000 PHP [Philippines pesos] to buy buttons, zippers and cloth and pay for sewing machine maintenance.  

Epifania would like to expand her business and markets to have more customers to increase her investment and profit. This loan will make the start of her plans possible. Her income will help buy food, pay the household bills and allow her to save.

loans.use: to buy buttons, zippers and cloth and pay for sewing machine maintenance.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai, 38 years old, is married and has two children, one son and one daughter. Her husband is a truck driver. She supports her family through the income she earns from running a general store. She has been in this business for two years. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Mai intends to take a loan to increase her working capital and buy different products such as plastic bags, detergent, shampoo, sugar, and coffee to sell at her store. The additional capital will enable her to increase her sales. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy bags, detergent, shampoo, sugar and coffee to stock her store.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en: Sophia lives in Buchanan. She is 45 years old and single with six children between the ages of 7 and 20; they are in school and live at home. For the past 10 years, she has been selling used clothes in the local market. She established the business with small loans from friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes to expand her business. In the future, she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes to expand her business.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang is 44 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns income as a bricklayer. Trang runs a cafe for earning a living. 

She started her business four years ago. She intends to take a loan to expand her business by buying a variety of different beverages to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy beverages to sell at her cafe.

loans.name: Tu

texts.en:
Tu, 39, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver for hire.

Tu has been running a business of sewing and processing garments for 16 years. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying materials and tools to increase her making of garments.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy materials and tools to make garments.

loans.name: Uyen

texts.en:
Uyen is 38 years old and married, with three sons. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She and her husband earns an income running a shop repairing vehicles and selling spare parts. 

She started this business 18 years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of spare parts to meet her customers' demand.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and equipment for her shop.

loans.name: Chin

texts.en:
Chin is 57 years old and married, with three children. Her husband is a worker at an insurance company. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

She has been running a general store in front of her door for two years. She started this business to cover her expenses and raise her children. 

Chin is requesting a loan to expand her business by offering more food and many kinds of soft drinks.  She hopes that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy food and soft drinks to sell at her store.

loans.name: Osam Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the Osam Group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone. Together, they are applying for a loan of 5,400,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to enable them to further expand their respective businesses. Consequently, they will make more profits and improve their standards of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Fatmata. She is 35 years old and was born in northern Sierra Leone. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a businessman and her children are attending primary and secondary schools.  For the past 15 years, Fatmata has been selling grocery store goods like milk, sugar, soft drinks, butter, biscuits, etc.  With this loan, she will expand her business by buying the previously mentioned items in larger quantities to add to her current stock for sale.

loans.use: to buy milk, sugar, soft drinks, butter, biscuits, etc. in larger quantities to add to her current stock of grocery store goods for sale

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru: Манзура родилась в 1983 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 1 ребенка. Манзура всегда мечтала стать учительницей. Однако трудное условие жизни и недостаток финансов стали преградой для того, чтобы поступить в университет. Манзура нашла работу и постепенно накопила денег. Три года назад она поступила в Таджикский Педагогический Университет Таджикистана. Она является студенткой 3 курса по специальности преподаватель истории и права. Она в этом году не в состоянии оплатить за учебный договор. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора.  Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Manzura was born in 1983. She is married and is raising one small child. Manzura always dreamed of becoming a teacher. However, difficult living conditions and lack of finances became a barrier to going to university. Manzura began work and gradually saved money.

Three years ago, she enrolled in Tajik Pedagogical University of Tajikistan. She is a third year student with a specialization as a teacher of history and law.

This year, she is not in a position to pay for tuition. She is requesting a loan to pay tuition.

loans.use: to pay for education

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Рано является повторной клиенткой ИМОН. Она честная женщина и вовремя погашает займ. Рано в 1988 года окончила университет по специальности биолога. Она уже 24 года работает в средней школе учителем биологии. Рано очень любит свою профессию и преподает с удовольствием. Она кормилица 4 детей. Ее муж трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Рано должна провести свадебное торжество ее дочери, но не имеет достаточно денег, так как у нее маленькая зарплата. Она должна еще дать приданное для своей дочери. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для проведения свадебного торжества своей дочери. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Rano is a returning customer of IMON. She is an honest woman and makes her loan payments on time. In 1988, Rano finished university with a specialization in biology. She has been working for 24 years already in a high school as a biology teacher. Rano loves her profession very much and teaches with great pleasure. She is the breadwinner for four children. Her husband is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation.

Rano needs to put on a wedding celebration for her daugher, but she does not have enough money since she has a small salary. She must also give a dowry for her daughter.

She is requesting a loan of 7,500 somoni for putting on her daughter's wedding celebration.

loans.use: to put on a wedding party for her daughter

loans.name: Maria  Eva

texts.es: La señora Maria Eva se dedica a su actividad  de venta de comida en un mercado, la señora tiene experiencia de 41 años ya que este negocio era familiar y ella desde muy temprana edad empezó como ayudante de su mamá. desde hace 20 años decidió independizarse poner su propio negocio con ahorro, la señora Eva tiene cuatro hijos de estos solo uno esta en edad escolar el cual depende de ella, trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las seis de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, solicita financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio y tener mercadería en existencia ya que ella manifiesta que si compra al por mayor le es mas favorable para ella.
texts.en:
Maria Eva sells food in a market.  She has 41 years of experience as this was a family business and she started helping her mother at a very early age. Twenty years ago she decided to become independent and start her own business with savings.  Eva has four children and only one is school-age and is dependent on her.  She works from Monday to Sunday from six in the morning until four in the afternoon.

She is asking for a loan to invest in her business so she can have merchandise in stock. It is better for her if she can buy at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy quintals of rice, sugar, and beans, drums of oil - ingredients.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Diana did not have access to any form of formal education. Yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Diana sells lotions and other personal products in Narkwa (near Elmina). She has been involved in this enterprise for six years. Diana is married to a carpenter and has one child. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband pay their child’s school fees. 

Diana has identified that there are growing demands among consumers for her product, but she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. She aims to use her loan to purchase more lotions to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Diana wants to buck the trend by ensuring that her offspring will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more lotions to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
Although he has received no prior formal education, James is an entrepreneur. He specializes in selling cellphone accessories and credit in Narkwa (near Elmina). 

He has been involved in this enterprise for three years. James is married and has four children. His wife works as a trader. The proceeds from his business normally go towards helping his wife cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

James will use the loan to purchase more cellphone accessories and credit, thus aiding him to improve his overall sales. With the new profits from his expanded business, James plans to further diversify the products that he sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to buy more cellphone accessories and credit, thus improving his overall sales.

loans.name: Ela

texts.en:
Ela lives in Buchanan.  She is 44 years old and did not go to school.  She is married with three children between the ages of 9 and 28, who are in school and live at home. 

Since 1998 she has been selling rice, oil, juice, soft drinks, etc., in the local market.  Se started this business with money given to her by her mother and learned it from her.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, juice, soft drinks, etc., for her business.

Her plans are to buy a piece of land and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, juice, soft drinks, etc., for her business

loans.name: Muso

texts.ru: Этого 60-летнего фермера зовут Мусо. Мусо проживает в районе Кубадиён, климат и природа которого благоприятна для ведения сельскохозяйственной деятельности и животноводства. Мусо со своей семьей занимается земледелием - выращиванием сельскохозяйственной культуры. Сейчас он решил начать еще один бизнес, чтобы улучшить условия проживания семьи. Мусо интересуется животноводческой деятельностью, а именно куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота. Его начальный капитал составляет 400 долларов. Мусо просит кредит, чтобы купить 4 голов молодых бычков и их корм. Он будет пасти скот на пастбище и на своем земельном участке. Сейчас он ждет поддержки, чтобы начать бизнес.
texts.en:
This 60-year-old farmer is named Muso. Muso resides in the Kubadiyon region, the climate and nature of which are favorable for running agricultural and livestock activities. Muso and his family work the land - growing agricultural crops.

Now, he has decided to start yet another business, in order to improve living conditions for his family. Muso is interested in livestock activities, and more specifically in the buying and selling of cattle. His starting capital consists of US$400. Muso is requesting a loan to buy four heads of young cattle and their feed. He will graze the cattle in the pastures and on his own plot of land. Now he is awaiting support to start his business.

loans.use: to buy four young bulls and their feed to start a business in fattening and selling cattle

loans.name: Rahima

texts.ru: Рахима более 15 лет занимается собственным бизнесом. Она трудолюбивая и успешная женщина. Рахима занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. Она опытная швея. Она была очень молодой девушкой,  когда только научилась шитью одежды и с новыми идеями шила свои первые платья. Рахима сегодня имеет большой опыт. Она предоставляет свои услуги у себя дома. Она воспитывает и обеспечивает 2 детей. Ее дети несовершеннолетние. Ее муж добрый и хороший человек, но имеет маленький доход. Рахима всегда старается для благополучия своих детей. Она планирует отремонтировать свой дом. Она сделала немного сбережения, но это не хватает для ремонта. Рахима запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки краски, шпаклевки и т.п. для ремонта дома. Она надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Rahima for more than 15 years has been engaged in her own business. She is a hardworking and successful woman. Rahima provides sewing services. She is an experienced seamstress. She was a very young girl when she only learned how to sew clothes and with new ideas sewed her first dress.

Rahima now has a lot of experience. She provides her services from her home. She is raising and supporting two children. Her children are minors. Her husband is a kind and good man, but has a small income.

Rahima is always striving for her children's well-being. She plans to make repairs on her home. She has made a small savings, but it is not enough for the repairs.

Rahima is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy paint, putty, etc. for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy paint and putty for repairing her house

loans.name: Qosimjon

texts.ru: Косимону 35 лет, он живет со своей семьей в Спитаменском районе. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Косимчон ранее занимался продажей сельхоз культур, сейчас хочет открыть собственный бизнес по откорму и продаже крупнорогатого скота. Косимчон планирует купить скот на местном рынке и откармливать в течение 30 дней, а после продать скот с наценкой на том же рынке. У Косимчона большая семья, он обеспечивает родителей жену и детей. Для него этот бизнес очень важен и для его бизнеса кредит очень нужен. Косимчон просит кредит, чтобы купить одну корову хорошей породы. Он решил не рисковать и начать с малого. По мере достижения опыта и успеха в бизнесе, он будет увеличивать поголовье скота. В данный момент он надеется на поддержку!
texts.en:
Qosimjon is 35 years old. He lives with his family in the Spitamen region. He is married and has two children. Qosimjon was previously engaged in selling crops, and now wants to open his own business in the fattening and sale of cattle. Qosimjon plans to buy cattle at the local market and to fatten them over the course of 30 days, and then to sell the cattle at a premium at the very same market.

Qosimjon has a large family; he is responsible for his wife's parents and his children. For him this business is very important and for his business a loan is very much needed.

Qosimjon is requesting a loan to buy one cow of a good breed. He decided not to take a risk and to start small. Along with gains in his level of experience and success in business, he will increase his cattle count. Currently, he is hoping for support!

loans.use: to buy and sell cattle

loans.name: Senieda

texts.es:
La señora Senieda es una madre soltera que reside en el Municipio de Condega a unos 35 Km al norte de la Cbecera departamental de Estelí, ella tiene una hija que estudia en secundaria y a quien le subre los gastos escolares.

Esta señora labora para el Ministerio de Salud desde hace aproximadamente unos 7 años en el area de limpieza manejando buenas relaciones laborales, siendo esta su principal fuente de ingreso para el sosten familiar.

Ella se presento a las oficinas de Ceprodel para solicitar por segunda vez un financiamiento para la compra de mercaderia como es ropa y cosméticos para luego revenderlos y obtener una ganacia de ello y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos, ya que su salario no le permite realizar esta compras por cuenta propia.

ella se muestra positica de que le sera otorgado dicho credito y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos ya que de ella depende el estudio de su hija.
texts.en: Senieda is a single mom who lives in Condega, a municipality about 35 km north of the capital city of the department of Estelí.  She has a daughter in secondary school, which is more expensive than she can afford.  Senieda has worked for the Ministry of Health for approximately seven years providing cleaning services, and she maintains good work relationships.  This is her primary income with which she supports her family.  She came to the Ceprodel office to request a loan for the second time to buy merchandise such as clothing and cosmetics to sell for a profit so she can increase her income, since her salary does not allow her to make these purchases on her own.  She is sure she will receive the loan so she can increase her income since her daughter's schooling depends on it.

loans.use: to buy clothing and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Luz Victoria

texts.es: La señora Luz Victoria tiene un taller de tortilleria desde hace 12 años en el barrio el Rosario, trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las cuatro de la mañana empieza a mandar a moler el maiz para luego ponerse a palmear tortillas y mandarlas  a vender con dos jovenes que salen a vender a las calles, la señora Victoria es una mujer luchadora, es madre de dos hijos, solo uno en edad escolar el otro niño no tiene la edad para asistir a la escuela, solicita el financiamiento para comprar maiz al por mayor y aprovechar la venta de buñuelos ya que en el mes de noviembre es buena esta venta y comprar yuca al por mayor.
texts.en: Luz Victoria has had a business making tortillas in the Rosario barrio for 12 years.  She works seven days a week from 4am, when she sends out the corn to be ground before preparing the tortillas.  After making them, she has two young employees who go out to sell the tortillas in the streets.  Victoria is a very plucky woman and is a mother to two children, one of whom is of school age, the other younger.  Victoria is applying for a loan to buy maize and yucca in bulk and to sell fritters, which always sell well in November.

loans.use: to buy hundredweights of corn, firewood, lime, beans, and yucca.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is 46 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn money by raising and selling cows, which she has been doing since 1993.

Phuong is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase a better quality foodstuff to feed her cows. She hopes this will enable her to earn a higher income from her business. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuff to feed her cows

loans.name: Quang

texts.en: Quang is requesting another loan, which he will use to buy many kinds of artificial hair and hair care products to sell at his store. The previous loan helped him to attract more new customers and increase his income level. He hope that his business will run smoothly and will help him to improve his family's living conditions and save money for his children's education.

loans.use: to buy artificial hair and hair care products.

loans.name: Gai

texts.en:
Gai, who is 50 years old, is single and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

She started a store selling kids' toys and cosmetic products 10 years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of toys and cosmetic products to sell at her store and better satisfy her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy toys and cosmetic products.

loans.name: Alexander Felipe

texts.es:
El señor Alexander se dedica a laborar como maestro  atendiendo jóvenes de varias edades en secundaria y cuya preocupación principal es la educación en estas personas ya que son el futuro de la nación y el mejoramiento de los niveles de vida. El trabajo de educación requiere de mucho sacrificio y seguimiento en la enseñanza aprendizaje.
Alexander visito  a Ceprodel porque requerir su tercer financiamiento  para la compra de  materiales de construcción tales como: zinc, plancha, bloques, cemento, zinc liso y pago de mano de obra,  Esto con el fin de iniciar el mejoramiento de su nivel de vida que tanto lo requiere para beneficio propio y familiar y de esa manera darle las condiciones que tanto anela como un buen padre de familia que quiere y piensa en lo mejor para ellos.
texts.en:
Alexander makes his living working as a teacher, helping high school youth of various ages. His primary concern is the education of these people, because they are the future of the country and the hope for improving quality of life. Working in education requires a lot of sacrifice and following up on teaching and learning.

Alexander visited Ceprodel because he needs his third loan to purchase construction materials such as: corrugated metal roofing, metal sheets, cinder blocks, cement and flat zinc sheets, and to pay for labor. He needs these things to begin improving his quality of life that he needs so much for his own benefit as well as for his family's. In this way, he would like to give them the conditions that he so much wants to as a good father who wants the best for them.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as: corrugated metal roofing, metal sheets, cinder blocks, cement and flat zinc sheets, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Khursheda

texts.en:
Khursheda is married and has three children, two of whom are adults. She always wanted to provide them with a good education and since her husband’s income is not enough to provide the family with a good quality of life, she decided to start a new sewing business. She studied the course, To Get Ahead, with a women's organization and acquired enough skills about business.  Her daughter will help her with the business. 

Khursheda is requesting a loan for 500 somoni, which she will use to buy a sewing machine for her new business. She hopes to be a very successful business woman as she is hardworking and smart.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh is 43 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband has been running a food stall in front of her house for 18 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and to generate income to raise her children.  

Thanh is requesting a loan, which she will use to expand her business by buying better food and rice to make good meals to sell. This will enable her to attract more customers and increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase food and rice.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh, 40, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including her two sons and her husband. Hanh and her husband earn money through their business of selling pork and noodles. Hanh is requesting a loan to buy better quality ingredients and raw food to make better soup. She hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy raw food and ingredients.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao would like to take a further loan to buy a greater quantity of waste materials to recycle and resell. Thao's previous loan enabled him to increase his sales and earn a higher income to support his family. 

He hopes that another loan will assist him in increasing the size of his business, attracting new customers, and increasing sales. He also hopes that through the loan he can increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more waste materials to recycle and resell.

loans.name: Cecila

texts.en:
Cecilia is 45 years old and married, with four children. 

She runs a cookery business in the Tombo Western rural area in Sierra Leone. She began her business to strive for her living

She’s been in this business since after the rebel war and sells a variety of local food and drinks within her community.  She says that the main problem to her business is the lack of capital to expand her business.

Cecilia requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more bags of rice, food commodities, and drinks for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her standard of living. 

In the future, she would like to open a big restaurant. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more bags of rice, food commodities, and drinks for resale.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet 35-year-old Kadiatu from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married, with three children. Two of her children are going to school. 

After the war, Kadiatu established her rubber-slipper business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. 

She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week, moving around the community to establish her goods. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business.

Kadiatu requires a loan to buy more rubber slippers for resale. She hopes the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. 

In the future, Kadiatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rubber slippers for resale.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es:
Miguel, esta casado y tiene tres hijos todos ellos independientes,ocupa 7 habitaciones en su casa la cual esta ubicada en la zona de Alto san Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.

Actualmente  percibe una renta de jubilado con la cual mantiene a su familia y puede solventar sus gastos mínimos.

El crédito que requiere es para pagar un tratamiento medico, con el cual pueda sentirse mejor ya que su Seguro Médico  no cubre algunos tratamientos porque son costosos y es mejor hacerlos de manera independiente. 

El sueño de Miguel es poder vivir mejor y no adoleser ningun dolor, ya que esto pone suceptible a la familia.

Es la sexta vez que solicita crédito en IMPRO y la segunda vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Miguel is married and has three children, who are all grown-up. He has a home with seven rooms which is located in the Alto San Pedro area of the city of La Paz.

He currently receives a pension which he uses to support his family and pay his basic expenses.

He needs the loan to pay for a medical treatment to make him better, as his medical insurance doesn't cover certain expensive treatments and it's better to pay for them independently.

Miguel's dream is to live better and not suffer from any pains, because this makes his family vulnerable.

This is the sixth time he is requesting a loan from IMPRO and the second time with KIVA.

loans.use: to get independent medical treament which isn't covered by his medical insurance.

loans.name: Danelia

texts.es:
Danelia es una señora, casada, no tiene hijos, de profesión maestra de educación primaria con 15 años de experiencia como es la Docencia.
Actualmente esta señora se presento a la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar el tercer financiamiento  ya que este lo utilizaría en la construcción de la tapia de su vivienda y la compra de materiales de construcción tales como bloques, cemento, hierro, y pago de mano de obra.
Ya que  con la construcción de esta tapia tendrá mayor seguridad y tranquilidad en su  vivienda.
Le agradece a Ceprodel por el apoyo oportuno que le ha brindado, este es el tercer  financiamiento y de esa manera ha ido mejorando su vivienda.
texts.en:
Danelia is a married woman who has no children.  By profession, she is a primary school teacher with 15 years of experience, as it goes with teaching.

This woman recently went to the office of Ceprodel to apply for her third loan, because she will use this one for constructing the wall around her house and for buying construction materials such as cinder blocks, cement and iron rods, and to pay for labor.  By building this wall, she will have greater security and peace at home.  

She is grateful to Ceprodel for the opportune support that they have given her.  This is her third loan, and in this way she has been improving her housing.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as:  cinder blocks, cement and iron rods, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Cecilia Del  Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Cecilia trabaja como maestra de primaria en un colegio de la localidad con 27 años de laborar, es casada con un hijo al que le brinda toda su ayuda para su formación.
Una de las necesidades que la señora Cecilia atraviesa hoy en día es de mejorar su salud ya que ella se encuentra enferma, ya que debido a esta necesidad  tomó la decisión de visitar Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito, el cual lo utilizara para  el pago atención medica, exámenes clínicos y transporte, ya que de esta manera mejorará su estado de salud.   Y la agradece a ceprodel  ya que con este financiamiento seria el número 6 y que le han ayudado mucho cuando más lo necesita.
texts.en: Cecilia has been a local elementary school teacher for 27 years. She is married and has a son, to whom she offers all the help needed to get an education. One of Cecilia's current issues is improving her health, as she has been ill. She decided to apply to Ceprodel for a loan to pay for medical appointments and tests and transportation so that her health will improve. She is grateful to Ceprodel, as this is her 6th loan cycle and the institution has helped her when she most needed it.

loans.use: to pay for medical appointments and tests and transportation.

loans.name: Juan Wilmer

texts.es:
Juan Wilmer tiene 36 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus 02 hijos en el Caserío de Mamaca una zona rural del Distrito de San Felipe, su población se dedica al comercio de ganadería y agricultura su clima es caluroso a dos horas de la ciudad e Jaén, ubicado en la Región de Cajamarca en la sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica hace más de 11 años a la Carpintería cuenta con un taller propio que funciona en su propio domicilio y posee una pequeña bodega, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales para seguir implementando su taller, atendiendo así la demanda insatisfecha en su zona y generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Juan Wilmer is 36 and lives with his wife and their two children in Caserío de Mamaca, a rural part of San Felipe District. Many people in Caserío de Mamaca are farmers or ranchers as the climate is warm and the city of Jaén, in Cajamarca Region in the northern sierra of Peru, is two hours away. 

Juan Wilmer has worked as a carpenter for over 11 years and has a workshop in his home, as well as a small grocery store. Juan Wilmer has applied for a loan of 3,000 new soles to purchase materials to continue growing his business. He hopes to meet the insatiable demand for his services in the region and earn a larger income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Katya Azucena

texts.es:
Katya Azucena tiene 24 años de edad, es madre soltera vive junto a sus hijos en la zona rural del Distrito de la Matanza donde su población realiza las actividades de comercio de animales menores y agricultura, ubicado en la Región Piura en la costa norte del Perú.

Azucena trabaja haciendo limpieza en una empresa de la zona y vende animales menores en su comunidad, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de aves de corral y animales menores para ofrecerlo a sus clientes generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Katya Azucena, 24, is a single mother living with her children in a rural zone in La Matanza District located in Piura Region on Peru’s north coast whose population works selling small animals and in agriculture.

She works cleaning a firm in the area and also sells small animals in her community.  She’s asked for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to buy barnyard fowl and small animals to sell to her customers thus generating higher family income.

loans.use: to buy small animals.

loans.name: Segundo Ruperto

texts.es:
Ruperto tiene 43 años de edad, vive en una zona rural e Oyotun una comunidad que se dedica al comercio de animales menores y cultivo de arroz, maíz, yuca, a dos horas d ela ciudad e Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, patos, gallinas, cuyes, su negocio está ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, Ruperto ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para comprar alimentos balanceados, lo que le permitirá una mejor producción y al mismo tiempo ingresos mayores para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ruperto is 43 years old.  He lives in a rural area of Oyotun, a community whose main trade is in small livestock and in growing rice, corn and yucca.  It is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Peru.

Ruperto makes his living raising and selling small livestock, such as ducks, hens and guinea pigs.  His business is located behind his house. 

Ruperto has applied for a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to buy animal feed, which will allow him better production and at the same time, greater income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed for ducks, hens and guinea pigs

loans.name: Tomas De La Cruz

texts.es:
Tomas de la Cruz tiene 56 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa en Nueva Arica, una zona que se caracteriza por el comercio de animales menores y cultivos de arroz, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo costa norte del Perú.

El tiene una bodega donde ofrece todo tipo de abarrotes y verduras, su esposa le apoya en esta labor su negocio está ubicado en su domicilio, Tomas de la Cruz por las tardes se dedica a labores agrícolas y ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para comprar abarrotes para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera obtener mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Tomas de la Cruz is 56 years old. He lives with his wife in Nueva Arica, an area characterized by the business of small animals and rice growing. It is an hour from the city of Chiclayo on the coast of northern Peru.

He has a store where he offers all types of groceries and vegetables. His wife helps him with this work and his business is located at his house. In the after noon, Tomas de la Cruz does farm work. He has asked for a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles to buy grocery items to stock his business and in this way obtain more income for his family.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like sugar, rice, milk and vegetable stews to stock his business.

loans.name: Luz Yessenia

texts.es:
Luz Yessenia tiene 37 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo y su mamá en la zona urbana de Cayaltí, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, adicionalmente asesora a sus clientes que en su mayoría son mujeres, es muy reconocida en su comunidad por el buen servicio que brinda.

Yessenia es una mujer emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2,200 nuevos soles para invertirlo en la compra de ropa para damas y de esta manera hacer crecer su pequeño negocio, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Yessenia, 37, lives with her son and her mother in the urban zone of Cayaltí, two hours from the city of Chiclayo in the northern coast of Peru. She makes her living selling beauty products. Additionally, she advises her clients who are mainly women. She is very well known in her community for the good service that she offers.

Yessenia is an enterprising woman. She has applied for a loan of 2,200 Nuevos Soles to invest in the purchase of clothing for women. In this manner, she will make her small business grow, generating more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy women's clothing to stock her business.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro tiene 44 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Cayaltí, su población se dedica al cultivo de caña y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedica a la venta y crianza de animales menores en la parte posterior de su domicilio,Ramiro trabaja como docente en el colegio de la zona y ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de una mototaxi lo que le facilitara desplazarse a su centro de trabajo, llevando a tres compañeros de trabajo como clientes que pagaran su cuota de pasaje.
texts.en:
Ramiro is 44 years old. He lives together with his family in the Cayaltí district. The people there work growing sugar cane and cattle. It is two hours from the city of Chiclayo, on the northern coast of Perú.

Ramiro and his wife work raising and selling small animals in the rear part of his home, and he also works in a high school near his home.  Ramiro has asked for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles to buy a mototaxi which will make it easy for him to commute to his work, carrying three co-workers who pay him a fare for the trip.

loans.use: Compra de una mototaxi.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
